net: And if Christ has not been raised, your faith is useless; you are still in your sins.
kjv: And if Christ be not raised, your faith [is] vain; ye are yet in your sins.

net: “How long must I bear with this evil congregation that murmurs against me? I have heard the complaints of the Israelites that they murmured against me.
kjv: How long [shall I bear with] this evil congregation, which murmur against me? I have heard the murmurings of the children of Israel, which they murmur against me.

net: The patriarchs, because they were jealous of Joseph, sold him into Egypt. But God was with him,
kjv: And the patriarchs, moved with envy, sold Joseph into Egypt: but God was with him,

net: For I raise up my hand to heaven, and say,‘As surely as I live forever,
kjv: For I lift up my hand to heaven, and say, I live for ever.

net: For I, the LORD, will speak. Whatever word I speak will be accomplished. It will not be delayed any longer. Indeed in your days, O rebellious house, I will speak the word and accomplish it, declares the Sovereign LORD.’”
kjv: For I [am] the LORD: I will speak, and the word that I shall speak shall come to pass; it shall be no more prolonged: for in your days, O rebellious house, will I say the word, and will perform it, saith the Lord GOD.

net: “All the servants of the king and the people of the king’s provinces know that there is only one law applicable to any man or woman who comes uninvited to the king in the inner court– that person will be put to death, unless the king extends to him the gold scepter, permitting him to be spared. Now I have not been invited to come to the king for some thirty days!”
kjv: All the king's servants, and the people of the king's provinces, do know, that whosoever, whether man or woman, shall come unto the king into the inner court, who is not called, [there is] one law of his to put [him] to death, except such to whom the king shall hold out the golden sceptre, that he may live: but I have not been called to come in unto the king these thirty days.

net: What you know, I know also; I am not inferior to you!
kjv: What ye know, [the same] do I know also: I [am] not inferior unto you.

net: Jokshan became the father of Sheba and Dedan. The descendants of Dedan were the Asshurites, Letushites, and Leummites.
kjv: And Jokshan begat Sheba, and Dedan. And the sons of Dedan were Asshurim, and Letushim, and Leummim.

net: Delilah said to Samson,“Look, you deceived me and told me lies! Now tell me how you can be subdued.”
kjv: And Delilah said unto Samson, Behold, thou hast mocked me, and told me lies: now tell me, I pray thee, wherewith thou mightest be bound.

net: O LORD my God, if I have done what they say, or am guilty of unjust actions,
kjv: O LORD my God, if I have done this; if there be iniquity in my hands;

net: All of them intend to do violence
kjv: They shall come all for violence: their faces shall sup up [as] the east wind, and they shall gather the captivity as the sand.

net: Listen! News is coming even now. The rumble of a great army is heard approaching from a land in the north. It is coming to turn the towns of Judah into rubble, places where only jackals live.
kjv: Behold, the noise of the bruit is come, and a great commotion out of the north country, to make the cities of Judah desolate, [and] a den of dragons.

net: If he holds back the waters, then they dry up; if he releases them, they destroy the land.
kjv: Behold, he withholdeth the waters, and they dry up: also he sendeth them out, and they overturn the earth.

net: I was in the Spirit on the Lord’s Day when I heard behind me a loud voice like a trumpet,
kjv: I was in the Spirit on the Lord's day, and heard behind me a great voice, as of a trumpet,

net: One who eats from its carcass must wash his clothes and be unclean until the evening, and whoever carries its carcass must wash his clothes and be unclean until the evening.
kjv: And he that eateth of the carcase of it shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even: he also that beareth the carcase of it shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even.

net: The water has been pure to this very day, just as Elisha prophesied.
kjv: So the waters were healed unto this day, according to the saying of Elisha which he spake.

net: Arphaxad was the father of Shelah, and Shelah was the father of Eber.
kjv: And Arphaxad begat Shelah, and Shelah begat Eber.

net: He said,“What pledge should I give you?” She replied,“Your seal, your cord, and the staff that’s in your hand.” So he gave them to her, then slept with her, and she became pregnant by him.
kjv: And he said, What pledge shall I give thee? And she said, Thy signet, and thy bracelets, and thy staff that [is] in thine hand. And he gave [it] her, and came in unto her, and she conceived by him.

net: The Lord Gives Solomon Wisdom Solomon made an alliance by marriage with Pharaoh, king of Egypt; he married Pharaoh’s daughter. He brought her to the City of David until he could finish building his residence and the temple of the LORD and the wall around Jerusalem.
kjv: And Solomon made affinity with Pharaoh king of Egypt, and took Pharaoh's daughter, and brought her into the city of David, until he had made an end of building his own house, and the house of the LORD, and the wall of Jerusalem round about.

net: and 32,000 young womenwho had not experienced a man’s bed.
kjv: And thirty and two thousand persons in all, of women that had not known man by lying with him.

net: And they saw that some of Jesus’ disciples ate their bread with unclean hands, that is, unwashed.
kjv: And when they saw some of his disciples eat bread with defiled, that is to say, with unwashen, hands, they found fault.

net: But Jesus said to Peter,“Put your sword back into its sheath! Am I not to drink the cup that the Father has given me?”
kjv: Then said Jesus unto Peter, ‹Put up thy sword into the sheath: the cup which my Father hath given me, shall I not drink it?›

net: An evil person seeks only rebellion, and so a cruel messenger will be sent against him.
kjv: An evil [man] seeketh only rebellion: therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.

net: Ishmael son of Nethaniah went out from Mizpah to meet them. He was pretending to cry as he walked along. When he met them, he said to them,“Come with me to meet Gedaliah son of Ahikam.”
kjv: And Ishmael the son of Nethaniah went forth from Mizpah to meet them, weeping all along as he went: and it came to pass, as he met them, he said unto them, Come to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam.

net: You have slacked off in the day of trouble– your strength is small!
kjv: [If] thou faint in the day of adversity, thy strength [is] small.

net: The nations will hear and tremble
kjv: The people shall hear, [and] be afraid: sorrow shall take hold on the inhabitants of Palestina.

net: By David. O LORD, I come before you in prayer.
kjv: [A Psalm] of David. Unto thee, O LORD, do I lift up my soul.

net: So he overthrew those cities and all that region, including all the inhabitants of the cities and the vegetation that grew from the ground.
kjv: And he overthrew those cities, and all the plain, and all the inhabitants of the cities, and that which grew upon the ground.

net: “Go and tell Ebed-Melech the Ethiopian,‘This is what the LORD of Heaven’s Armies, the God of Israel, has said,“I will carry out against this city what I promised. It will mean disaster and not good fortune for it. When that disaster happens, you will be there to see it.
kjv: Go and speak to Ebedmelech the Ethiopian, saying, Thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I will bring my words upon this city for evil, and not for good; and they shall be [accomplished] in that day before thee.

net: for your sins and your ancestors’ sins,” says the LORD.“Because they burned incense on the mountains and offended me on the hills, I will punish them in full measure.”
kjv: Your iniquities, and the iniquities of your fathers together, saith the LORD, which have burned incense upon the mountains, and blasphemed me upon the hills: therefore will I measure their former work into their bosom.

net: one gold pan weighing 10 shekels, full of incense;
kjv: One golden spoon of ten [shekels], full of incense:

net: Now the herdsmen ran off and spread the news in the town and countryside, and the people went out to see what had happened.
kjv: And they that fed the swine fled, and told [it] in the city, and in the country. And they went out to see what it was that was done.

net: Pray that your flight may not be in winter or on a Sabbath.
kjv: ‹But pray ye that your flight be not in the winter, neither on the sabbath day:›

net: the descendants of Hagab, the descendants of Shalmai, the descendants of Hanan,
kjv: The children of Hagab, the children of Shalmai, the children of Hanan,

net: You are righteous with regard to all that has happened to us, for you have acted faithfully. It is we who have been in the wrong!
kjv: Howbeit thou [art] just in all that is brought upon us; for thou hast done right, but we have done wickedly:

net: just as also you have partly understood us, that we are your source of pride just as you also are ours in the day of the Lord Jesus.
kjv: As also ye have acknowledged us in part, that we are your rejoicing, even as ye also [are] ours in the day of the Lord Jesus.

net: After pride came, disgrace followed; but wisdom came with humility.
kjv: [When] pride cometh, then cometh shame: but with the lowly [is] wisdom.

net: Many say,“Who can show us anything good?” Smile upon us, LORD!
kjv: [There be] many that say, Who will shew us [any] good? LORD, lift thou up the light of thy countenance upon us.

net: Peter’s Restoration Then when they had finished breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter,“Simon, son of John, do you love me more than these do?” He replied,“Yes, Lord, you know I love you.” Jesus told him,“Feed my lambs.”
kjv: So when they had dined, Jesus saith to Simon Peter, ‹Simon,› [son] ‹of Jonas, lovest thou me more than these?› He saith unto him, Yea, Lord; thou knowest that I love thee. He saith unto him, ‹Feed my lambs.›

net: Narrative Interlude Then Moses went with Joshua son of Nun and recited all the words of this song to the people.
kjv: And Moses came and spake all the words of this song in the ears of the people, he, and Hoshea the son of Nun.

net: They came from Ephraim, who uprooted Amalek, they follow after you, Benjamin, with your soldiers. From Makir leaders came down, from Zebulun came the ones who march carrying an officer’s staff.
kjv: Out of Ephraim [was there] a root of them against Amalek; after thee, Benjamin, among thy people; out of Machir came down governors, and out of Zebulun they that handle the pen of the writer.

net: the pure gold trimming shears, basins, pans, and censers, and the gold door sockets for the inner sanctuary(the most holy place) and for the doors of the main hall of the temple.
kjv: And the snuffers, and the basons, and the spoons, and the censers, [of] pure gold: and the entry of the house, the inner doors thereof for the most holy [place], and the doors of the house of the temple, [were of] gold.

net: Then he must remove all of its fat(just as fat was removed from the peace offering sacrifice) and the priest must offer it up in smoke on the altar for a soothing aroma to the LORD. So the priest will make atonement on his behalf and he will be forgiven.
kjv: And he shall take away all the fat thereof, as the fat is taken away from off the sacrifice of peace offerings; and the priest shall burn [it] upon the altar for a sweet savour unto the LORD; and the priest shall make an atonement for him, and it shall be forgiven him.

net: (6:1) The sons of Levi:Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.
kjv: The sons of Levi; Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.

net: from the tribe of Gad: Ramoth in Gilead(a city of refuge for one who committed manslaughter), Mahanaim,
kjv: And out of the tribe of Gad, Ramoth in Gilead with her suburbs, [to be] a city of refuge for the slayer; and Mahanaim with her suburbs,

net: The entire group numbered 42,360,
kjv: The whole congregation together [was] forty and two thousand three hundred [and] threescore,

net: for their Protector is strong
kjv: For their redeemer [is] mighty he shall plead their cause with thee.

net: The Benjaminites heard that the Israelites had gone up to Mizpah. Then the Israelites said,“Explain how this wicked thing happened!”
kjv: (Now the children of Benjamin heard that the children of Israel were gone up to Mizpeh.) Then said the children of Israel, Tell [us], how was this wickedness?

net: Having heard everything, I have reached this conclusion: Fear God and keep his commandments, because this is the whole duty of man.
kjv: Let us hear the conclusion of the whole matter: Fear God, and keep his commandments: for this [is] the whole [duty] of man.

net: King Rehoboam sent Hadoram, the supervisor of the work crews, out after them, but the Israelites stoned him to death. King Rehoboam managed to jump into his chariot and escape to Jerusalem.
kjv: Then king Rehoboam sent Hadoram that [was] over the tribute; and the children of Israel stoned him with stones, that he died. But king Rehoboam made speed to get him up to [his] chariot, to flee to Jerusalem.

net: in using gold, silver, bronze, and iron. Get up and begin the work! May the LORD be with you!”
kjv: Of the gold, the silver, and the brass, and the iron, [there is] no number. Arise [therefore], and be doing, and the LORD be with thee.

net: Let us go up at once to Bethel. Then I will make an altar there to God, who responded to me in my time of distress and has been with me wherever I went.”
kjv: And let us arise, and go up to Bethel; and I will make there an altar unto God, who answered me in the day of my distress, and was with me in the way which I went.

net: He put five basins on the south side of the temple and five on the north side. He put“The Sea” on the south side, in the southeast corner.
kjv: And he put five bases on the right side of the house, and five on the left side of the house: and he set the sea on the right side of the house eastward over against the south.

net: Look, I am stirring up the Medes to attack them; they are not concerned about silver, nor are they interested in gold.
kjv: Behold, I will stir up the Medes against them, which shall not regard silver; and [as for] gold, they shall not delight in it.

net: Therefore be resolved not to rehearse ahead of time how to make your defense.
kjv: ‹Settle› [it] ‹therefore in your hearts, not to meditate before what ye shall answer:›

net: Testing the Spirits Dear friends, do not believe every spirit, but test the spirits to determine if they are from God, because many false prophets have gone out into the world.
kjv: Beloved, believe not every spirit, but try the spirits whether they are of God: because many false prophets are gone out into the world.

net: Then he directed them all to sit down in groups on the green grass.
kjv: And he commanded them to make all sit down by companies upon the green grass.

net: Let your eyes look directly in front of you and let your gaze look straight before you.
kjv: Let thine eyes look right on, and let thine eyelids look straight before thee.

net: So David went up as Gad instructed him to do in the name of the LORD.
kjv: And David went up at the saying of Gad, which he spake in the name of the LORD.

net: Come! Listen, all you who are loyal to God! I will declare what he has done for me.
kjv: Come [and] hear, all ye that fear God, and I will declare what he hath done for my soul.

net: for he refuted the Jews vigorously in public debate, demonstrating from the scriptures that the Christ was Jesus.
kjv: For he mightily convinced the Jews, [and that] publickly, shewing by the scriptures that Jesus was Christ.

net: I came to the exiles at Tel Abib, who lived by the Kebar River. I sat dumbfounded among them there, where they were living, for seven days.
kjv: Then I came to them of the captivity at Telabib, that dwelt by the river of Chebar, and I sat where they sat, and remained there astonished among them seven days.

net: You must serve me as your father David did. Do everything I commanded and obey my rules and regulations.
kjv: And as for thee, if thou wilt walk before me, as David thy father walked, and do according to all that I have commanded thee, and shalt observe my statutes and my judgments;

net: O mountains of Gilboa, may there be no dew or rain on you, nor fields of grain offerings! For it was there that the shield of warriors was defiled; the shield of Saul lies neglected without oil.
kjv: Ye mountains of Gilboa, [let there be] no dew, neither [let there be] rain, upon you, nor fields of offerings: for there the shield of the mighty is vilely cast away, the shield of Saul, [as though he had] not [been] anointed with oil.

net: will you, with him, spread out the clouds, solid as a mirror of molten metal?
kjv: Hast thou with him spread out the sky, [which is] strong, [and] as a molten looking glass?

net: Joshua told the Israelites,“Come here and listen to the words of the LORD your God!”
kjv: And Joshua said unto the children of Israel, Come hither, and hear the words of the LORD your God.

net: Do not slander a servant to his master, lest he curse you, and you are found guilty.
kjv: Accuse not a servant unto his master, lest he curse thee, and thou be found guilty.

net: Simon Peter, Thomas(called Didymus), Nathanael(who was from Cana in Galilee), the sons of Zebedee, and two other disciples of his were together.
kjv: There were together Simon Peter, and Thomas called Didymus, and Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, and the [sons] of Zebedee, and two other of his disciples.

net: However, God’s solid foundation remains standing, bearing this seal:“The Lord knows those who are his,” and“Everyone who confesses the name of the Lord must turn away from evil.”
kjv: Nevertheless the foundation of God standeth sure, having this seal, The Lord knoweth them that are his. And, Let every one that nameth the name of Christ depart from iniquity.

net: They repay my love with accusations, but I continue to pray.
kjv: For my love they are my adversaries: but I [give myself unto] prayer.

net: “For just as the new heavens and the new earth I am about to make will remain standing before me,” says the LORD,“so your descendants and your name will remain.
kjv: For as the new heavens and the new earth, which I will make, shall remain before me, saith the LORD, so shall your seed and your name remain.

net: Malkijah son of Harim and Hasshub son of Pahath-Moab worked on another section and the Tower of the Fire Pots.
kjv: Malchijah the son of Harim, and Hashub the son of Pahathmoab, repaired the other piece, and the tower of the furnaces.

net: And regard the patience of our Lord as salvation, just as also our dear brother Paul wrote to you, according to the wisdom given to him,
kjv: And account [that] the longsuffering of our Lord [is] salvation even as our beloved brother Paul also according to the wisdom given unto him hath written unto you

net: From the time I went to speak to Pharaoh in your name, he has caused trouble for this people, and you have certainly not rescued them!”
kjv: For since I came to Pharaoh to speak in thy name, he hath done evil to this people; neither hast thou delivered thy people at all.

net: Now then, my son, do what I say. Run away immediately to my brother Laban in Haran.
kjv: Now therefore, my son, obey my voice; and arise, flee thou to Laban my brother to Haran;

net: And on the fifteenth day of this month is the festival. For seven days bread made without yeast must be eaten.
kjv: And in the fifteenth day of this month [is] the feast: seven days shall unleavened bread be eaten.

net: Therefore I, the LORD, say:‘I will indeed hand this city over to King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon and the Babylonian army. They will capture it.
kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD; Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the Chaldeans, and into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, and he shall take it:

net: So whoever swears by the altar swears by it and by everything on it.
kjv: ‹Whoso therefore shall swear by the altar, sweareth by it, and by all things thereon.›

net: I will never declare that you three are in the right; until I die, I will not set aside my integrity!
kjv: God forbid that I should justify you: till I die I will not remove mine integrity from me.

net: And what I am doing I will continue to do, so that I may eliminate any opportunity for those who want a chance to be regarded as our equals in the things they boast about.
kjv: But what I do, that I will do, that I may cut off occasion from them which desire occasion; that wherein they glory, they may be found even as we.

net: In the spring, at the time when kings normally conduct wars, Joab led the army into battle and devastated the land of the Ammonites. He went and besieged Rabbah, while David stayed in Jerusalem. Joab defeated Rabbah and tore it down.
kjv: And it came to pass, that after the year was expired, at the time that kings go out [to battle], Joab led forth the power of the army, and wasted the country of the children of Ammon, and came and besieged Rabbah. But David tarried at Jerusalem. And Joab smote Rabbah, and destroyed it.

net: The LORD’s Spirit empowered him and he led Israel. When he went to do battle, the LORD handed over to him King Cushan-Rishathaim of Armon and he overpowered him.
kjv: And the Spirit of the LORD came upon him, and he judged Israel, and went out to war: and the LORD delivered Chushanrishathaim king of Mesopotamia into his hand; and his hand prevailed against Chushanrishathaim.

net: Their job was to help Aaron’s descendants in the service of the LORD’s temple. They were to take care of the courtyards, the rooms, ceremonial purification of all holy items, and other jobs related to the service of God’s temple.
kjv: Because their office [was] to wait on the sons of Aaron for the service of the house of the LORD, in the courts, and in the chambers, and in the purifying of all holy things, and the work of the service of the house of God;

net: A musical composition by David, which he sang to the LORD concerning a Benjaminite named Cush. O LORD my God, in you I have taken shelter. Deliver me from all who chase me! Rescue me!
kjv: Shiggaion of David, which he sang unto the LORD, concerning the words of Cush the Benjamite. O LORD my God, in thee do I put my trust: save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me:

net: chief Magdiel, chief Iram. These were the chiefs of Edom, according to their settlements in the land they possessed. This was Esau, the father of the Edomites.
kjv: Duke Magdiel, duke Iram: these [be] the dukes of Edom, according to their habitations in the land of their possession: he [is] Esau the father of the Edomites.

net: All the men of Israel got up from their places and took their positions at Baal Tamar, while the Israelites hiding in ambush jumped out of their places west of Gibeah.
kjv: And all the men of Israel rose up out of their place, and put themselves in array at Baaltamar: and the liers in wait of Israel came forth out of their places, [even] out of the meadows of Gibeah.

net: But you have come to Mount Zion, the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, and to myriads of angels, to the assembly
kjv: But ye are come unto mount Sion, and unto the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, and to an innumerable company of angels,

net: You are to make its pots for the ashes, its shovels, its tossing bowls, its meat hooks, and its fire pans– you are to make all its utensils of bronze.
kjv: And thou shalt make his pans to receive his ashes, and his shovels, and his basons, and his fleshhooks, and his firepans: all the vessels thereof thou shalt make [of] brass.

net: Now it was Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and the other women with them who told these things to the apostles.
kjv: It was Mary Magdalene, and Joanna, and Mary [the mother] of James, and other [women that were] with them, which told these things unto the apostles.

net: This will be your confirmation that I have spoken the truth: This year you will eat what grows wild, and next year what grows on its own from that. But in the third year you will plant seed and harvest crops; you will plant vines and consume their produce.
kjv: And this [shall be] a sign unto thee, Ye shall eat this year such things as grow of themselves, and in the second year that which springeth of the same; and in the third year sow ye, and reap, and plant vineyards, and eat the fruits thereof.

net: You will be reestablished when I vindicate you. You will not experience oppression; indeed, you will not be afraid. You will not be terrified, for nothing frightening will come near you.
kjv: In righteousness shalt thou be established: thou shalt be far from oppression for thou shalt not fear: and from terror

net: I choose the path of faithfulness
kjv: I have chosen the way of truth: thy judgments have I laid [before me].

net: So the Israelites marched toward the Benjaminites the next day.
kjv: And the children of Israel came near against the children of Benjamin the second day.

net: The Israelites said to Moses,“We are bound to die! We perish, we all perish!
kjv: And the children of Israel spake unto Moses, saying, Behold, we die, we perish, we all perish.

net: You are blind! For which is greater, the gift or the altar that makes the gift sacred?
kjv: [Ye] ‹fools and blind: for whether› [is] ‹greater, the gift, or the altar that sanctifieth the gift?›

net: Tell them to do good, to be rich in good deeds, to be generous givers, sharing with others.
kjv: That they do good, that they be rich in good works, ready to distribute, willing to communicate;

net: Then Jesus came up and said to them,“All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me.
kjv: And Jesus came and spake unto them, saying, ‹All power is given unto me in heaven and in earth.›

net: Indeed! If it was not made into anything useful when it was whole, how much less can it be made into anything when the fire has burned it up and it is charred?
kjv: Behold, when it was whole, it was meet for no work: how much less shall it be meet yet for [any] work, when the fire hath devoured it, and it is burned?

net: until the time when his prediction came true. The LORD’s word proved him right.
kjv: Until the time that his word came: the word of the LORD tried him.

net: The sea is his, for he made it. His hands formed the dry land.
kjv: The sea [is] his, and he made it: and his hands formed the dry [land].

net: But he left behind some of the poor and gave them fields and vineyards.
kjv: But Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left [certain] of the poor of the land for vinedressers and for husbandmen.

net: The Basis of Israel’s Election It is not because you were more numerous than all the other peoples that the LORD favored and chose you– for in fact you were the least numerous of all peoples.
kjv: The LORD did not set his love upon you, nor choose you, because ye were more in number than any people; for ye [were] the fewest of all people:

net: The men hiding in ambush made a mad dash to Gibeah. They attacked and put the sword to the entire city.
kjv: And the liers in wait hasted, and rushed upon Gibeah; and the liers in wait drew [themselves] along, and smote all the city with the edge of the sword.

net: I will set my face against them– although they have escaped from the fire, the fire will still consume them! Then you will know that I am the LORD, when I set my face against them.
kjv: And I will set my face against them; they shall go out from [one] fire, and [another] fire shall devour them; and ye shall know that I [am] the LORD, when I set my face against them.

net: And if Satan rises against himself and is divided, he is not able to stand and his end has come.
kjv: ‹And if Satan rise up against himself, and be divided, he cannot stand, but hath an end.›

net: I will put an end to all her celebration: her annual religious festivals, monthly new moon celebrations, and weekly Sabbath festivities– all her appointed festivals.
kjv: I will also cause all her mirth to cease, her feast days, her new moons, and her sabbaths, and all her solemn feasts.

net: But as for you, if you warn the wicked and he does not turn from his wicked deed and from his wicked lifestyle, he will die for his iniquity but you will have saved your own life.
kjv: Yet if thou warn the wicked, and he turn not from his wickedness, nor from his wicked way, he shall die in his iniquity; but thou hast delivered thy soul.

net: And what you sow is not the body that is to be, but a bare seed– perhaps of wheat or something else.
kjv: And that which thou sowest, thou sowest not that body that shall be, but bare grain, it may chance of wheat, or of some other [grain]:

net: Then all the men who were aware that their wives were sacrificing to other gods, as well as all their wives, answered Jeremiah. There was a great crowd of them representing all the people who lived in northern and southern Egypt. They answered,
kjv: Then all the men which knew that their wives had burned incense unto other gods, and all the women that stood by, a great multitude, even all the people that dwelt in the land of Egypt, in Pathros, answered Jeremiah, saying,

net: Then on the eighth day he is to take for himself two turtledoves or two young pigeons, and he is to present himself before the LORD at the entrance of the Meeting Tent and give them to the priest,
kjv: And on the eighth day he shall take to him two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, and come before the LORD unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and give them unto the priest:

net: Our Lord is great and has awesome power
kjv: Great [is] our Lord, and of great power: his understanding [is] infinite.

net: Dogs will eat the members of your family who die in the city, and the birds of the sky will eat the ones who die in the country.”’ Indeed, the LORD has announced it!
kjv: Him that dieth of Jeroboam in the city shall the dogs eat and him that dieth in the field shall the fowls of the air eat: for the LORD hath spoken [it].

net: and when he found him, he brought him to Antioch. So for a whole year Barnabas and Saul met with the church and taught a significant number of people. Now it was in Antioch that the disciples were first called Christians.
kjv: And when he had found him, he brought him unto Antioch. And it came to pass, that a whole year they assembled themselves with the church, and taught much people. And the disciples were called Christians first in Antioch.

net: My eyes grow tired as I wait for your deliverance, for your reliable promise to be fulfilled.
kjv: Mine eyes fail for thy salvation, and for the word of thy righteousness.

net: Jonathan replied to David,“Tell me what I can do for you.”
kjv: Then said Jonathan unto David, Whatsoever thy soul desireth, I will even do [it] for thee.

net: So they said to him,“Then what miraculous sign will you perform, so that we may see it and believe you? What will you do?
kjv: They said therefore unto him, What sign shewest thou then, that we may see, and believe thee? what dost thou work?

net: But those in Jerusalem will view it as a false omen. They have sworn solemn oaths, but the king of Babylon will accuse them of violations in order to seize them.
kjv: And it shall be unto them as a false divination in their sight, to them that have sworn oaths: but he will call to remembrance the iniquity, that they may be taken.

net: Job’s Integrity in Suffering So Satan went out from the presence of the LORD, and he afflicted Job with a malignant ulcer from the soles of his feet to the top of his head.
kjv: So went Satan forth from the presence of the LORD, and smote Job with sore boils from the sole of his foot unto his crown.

net: Your children will be cursed, as well as the produce of your soil, the calves of your herds, and the lambs of your flocks.
kjv: Cursed [shall be] the fruit of thy body, and the fruit of thy land, the increase of thy kine, and the flocks of thy sheep.

net: A psalm of David, written when he fled from his son Absalom. LORD, how numerous are my enemies! Many attack me.
kjv: A Psalm of David, when he fled from Absalom his son. LORD, how are they increased that trouble me! many [are] they that rise up against me.

net: Then she had yet another son, whom she named Shelah. She gave birth to him in Kezib.
kjv: And she yet again conceived, and bare a son; and called his name Shelah: and he was at Chezib, when she bare him.

net: even the darkness is not too dark for you to see, and the night is as bright as day; darkness and light are the same to you.
kjv: Yea, the darkness hideth not from thee; but the night shineth as the day: the darkness and the light [are] both alike [to thee].

net: He told his servant,“Go on up and look in the direction of the sea.” So he went on up, looked, and reported,“There is nothing.” Seven times Elijah sent him to look.
kjv: And said to his servant, Go up now, look toward the sea. And he went up, and looked, and said, [There is] nothing. And he said, Go again seven times.

net: So I am ready to bring disaster on the dynasty of Jeroboam. I will cut off every last male belonging to Jeroboam in Israel, including even the weak and incapacitated. I will burn up the dynasty of Jeroboam, just as one burns manure until it is completely consumed.
kjv: Therefore, behold, I will bring evil upon the house of Jeroboam, and will cut off from Jeroboam him that pisseth against the wall, [and] him that is shut up and left in Israel, and will take away the remnant of the house of Jeroboam, as a man taketh away dung, till it be all gone.

net: The Philistines took the ark of God and brought it into the temple of Dagon, where they positioned it beside Dagon.
kjv: When the Philistines took the ark of God, they brought it into the house of Dagon, and set it by Dagon.

net: May those who say,“Aha! Aha!” be driven back and disgraced!
kjv: Let them be turned back for a reward of their shame that say, Aha, aha.

net: Does an ax exalt itself over the one who wields it, or a saw magnify itself over the one who cuts with it? As if a scepter should brandish the one who raises it, or a staff should lift up what is not made of wood!
kjv: Shall the axe boast itself against him that heweth therewith? [or] shall the saw magnify itself against him that shaketh it? as if the rod should shake [itself] against them that lift it up, [or] as if the staff should lift up [itself, as if it were] no wood.

net: I will attack you
kjv: And I will turn my hand upon thee, and purely purge away thy dross, and take away all thy tin:

net: the king of Libnah(one), the king of Adullam(one),
kjv: The king of Libnah, one; the king of Adullam, one;

net: ‘I will give you an eternal dynasty and establish your throne throughout future generations.’”(Selah)
kjv: Thy seed will I establish for ever, and build up thy throne to all generations. Selah.

net: You are to speak everything I command you, and your brother Aaron is to tell Pharaoh that he must release the Israelites from his land.
kjv: Thou shalt speak all that I command thee: and Aaron thy brother shall speak unto Pharaoh, that he send the children of Israel out of his land.

net: So Bathsheba visited the king in his private quarters.(The king was very old, and Abishag the Shunammite was serving the king.)
kjv: And Bathsheba went in unto the king into the chamber: and the king was very old and Abishag the Shunammite ministered unto the king.

net: Then the LORD’s message came to me,
kjv: Then the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,

net: Joshua told them,“Go in front of the ark of the LORD your God to the middle of the Jordan. Each of you is to put a stone on his shoulder, according to the number of the Israelite tribes.
kjv: And Joshua said unto them, Pass over before the ark of the LORD your God into the midst of Jordan, and take ye up every man of you a stone upon his shoulder, according unto the number of the tribes of the children of Israel:

net: By David. To you, O LORD, I cry out! My protector, do not ignore me! If you do not respond to me, I will join those who are descending into the grave.
kjv: [A Psalm] of David. Unto thee will I cry, O LORD my rock; be not silent to me: lest, [if] thou be silent to me, I become like them that go down into the pit.

net: What I say to you in the dark, tell in the light, and what is whispered in your ear, proclaim from the housetops.
kjv: ‹What I tell you in darkness,› [that] ‹speak ye in light: and what ye hear in the ear,› [that] ‹preach ye upon the housetops.›

net: On the seventh day Elishama son of Ammihud, leader of the Ephraimites, presented an offering.
kjv: On the seventh day Elishama the son of Ammihud, prince of the children of Ephraim, [offered]:

net: Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet.
kjv: And Elishama, and Eliada, and Eliphalet.

net: Camel caravans will cover your roads, young camels from Midian and Ephah. All the merchants of Sheba will come, bringing gold and incense and singing praises to the LORD.
kjv: The multitude of camels shall cover thee, the dromedaries of Midian and Ephah; all they from Sheba shall come: they shall bring gold and incense; and they shall shew forth the praises of the LORD.

net: Saul camped by the road on the hill of Hakilah near Jeshimon, but David was staying in the wilderness. When he realized that Saul had come to the wilderness to find him,
kjv: And Saul pitched in the hill of Hachilah, which [is] before Jeshimon, by the way. But David abode in the wilderness, and he saw that Saul came after him into the wilderness.

net: You shall rejoice before him– you, your son, your daughter, your male and female slaves, the Levites in your villages, the resident foreigners, the orphans, and the widows among you– in the place where the LORD chooses to locate his name.
kjv: And thou shalt rejoice before the LORD thy God, thou, and thy son, and thy daughter, and thy manservant, and thy maidservant, and the Levite that [is] within thy gates, and the stranger, and the fatherless, and the widow, that [are] among you, in the place which the LORD thy God hath chosen to place his name there.

net: There were windows all around it and its porches, like the windows of the others; 87½ feet long and 43¾ feet wide.
kjv: And [there were] windows in it and in the arches thereof round about, like those windows: the length [was] fifty cubits, and the breadth five and twenty cubits.

net: Famine Relief for Judea At that time some prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch.
kjv: And in these days came prophets from Jerusalem unto Antioch.

net: to the space above the entrance, to the inner room, and on the outside, and on all the walls in the inner room and outside, by measurement.
kjv: To that above the door, even unto the inner house, and without, and by all the wall round about within and without, by measure.

net: The two and a half tribes have received their inheritance on this side of the Jordan, east of Jericho, toward the sunrise.”
kjv: The two tribes and the half tribe have received their inheritance on this side Jordan [near] Jericho eastward, toward the sunrising.

net: Then the LORD said to Moses:“I have seen this people. Look what a stiff-necked people they are!
kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, I have seen this people, and, behold, it [is] a stiffnecked people:

net: Solomon ruled over all Israel from Jerusalem for forty years.
kjv: And the time that Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel [was] forty years.

net: Then they attacked En Mishpat(that is, Kadesh) again, and they conquered all the territory of the Amalekites, as well as the Amorites who were living in Hazazon Tamar.
kjv: And they returned, and came to Enmishpat, which [is] Kadesh, and smote all the country of the Amalekites, and also the Amorites, that dwelt in Hazezontamar.

net: Paul Travels Through Macedonia and Greece After the disturbance had ended, Paul sent for the disciples, and after encouraging them and saying farewell, he left to go to Macedonia.
kjv: And after the uproar was ceased, Paul called unto [him] the disciples, and embraced [them], and departed for to go into Macedonia.

net: The LORD your God will give them over to you
kjv: But the LORD thy God shall deliver them unto thee, and shall destroy them with a mighty destruction, until they be destroyed.

net: and listen to what they are saying. Then you will be brave and attack the camp.” So he went down with Purah his servant to where the sentries were guarding the camp.
kjv: And thou shalt hear what they say and afterward shall thine hands be strengthened to go down unto the host. Then went he down with Phurah his servant unto the outside of the armed men that [were] in the host.

net: Hepher the Mekerathite,Ahijah the Pelonite,
kjv: Hepher the Mecherathite, Ahijah the Pelonite,

net: “I have heard many things like these before. What miserable comforters are you all!
kjv: I have heard many such things: miserable comforters [are] ye all.

net: Now may the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace as you believe in him, so that you may abound in hope by the power of the Holy Spirit.
kjv: Now the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that ye may abound in hope, through the power of the Holy Ghost.

net: My conversation and my preaching were not with persuasive words of wisdom, but with a demonstration of the Spirit and of power,
kjv: And my speech and my preaching [was] not with enticing words of man's wisdom, but in demonstration of the Spirit and of power:

net: Bakbukiah and Unni, their colleagues, stood opposite them in the services.
kjv: Also Bakbukiah and Unni, their brethren, [were] over against them in the watches.

net: But his wife said to him,“If the LORD wanted to kill us, he would not have accepted the burnt offering and the grain offering from us. He would not have shown us all these things, or have spoken to us like this just now.”
kjv: But his wife said unto him, If the LORD were pleased to kill us, he would not have received a burnt offering and a meat offering at our hands, neither would he have shewed us all these [things], nor would as at this time have told us [such things] as these.

net: Starting a quarrel is like letting out water
kjv: The beginning of strife [is as] when one letteth out water: therefore leave off contention, before it be meddled with.

net: By faith the walls of Jericho fell after the people marched around them for seven days.
kjv: By faith the walls of Jericho fell down, after they were compassed about seven days.

net: Once and for all I have vowed by my own holiness, I will never deceive David.
kjv: Once have I sworn by my holiness that I will not lie unto David.

net: No servant can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and money.”
kjv: ‹No servant can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.›

net: Day after day when I was with you in the temple courts, you did not arrest me. But this is your hour, and that of the power of darkness!”
kjv: ‹When I was daily with you in the temple, ye stretched forth no hands against me: but this is your hour, and the power of darkness.›

net: The Condemnation of the Unrighteous For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of people who suppress the truth by their unrighteousness,
kjv: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men, who hold the truth in unrighteousness;

net: For the Amalekites and the Canaanites are there before you, and you will fall by the sword. Because you have turned away from the LORD, the LORD will not be with you.”
kjv: For the Amalekites and the Canaanites [are] there before you, and ye shall fall by the sword: because ye are turned away from the LORD, therefore the LORD will not be with you.

net: But since you abandoned me and worshiped other gods, I will not deliver you again.
kjv: Yet ye have forsaken me, and served other gods: wherefore I will deliver you no more.

net: But they kept on shouting,“Crucify, crucify him!”
kjv: But they cried, saying, Crucify [him], crucify him.

net: They surrounded the Benjaminites, chased them from Nohah, and annihilated them all the way to a spot east of Geba.
kjv: [Thus] they inclosed the Benjamites round about, [and] chased them, [and] trode them down with ease over against Gibeah toward the sunrising.

net: Your throne has been secure from ancient times
kjv: Thy throne [is] established of old: thou [art] from everlasting.

net: A psalm of David. The LORD is my shepherd, I lack nothing.
kjv: A Psalm of David. The LORD [is] my shepherd I shall not want.

net: Is it not enough for you to feed on the good pasture, that you must trample the rest of your pastures with your feet? When you drink clean water, must you muddy the rest of the water by trampling it with your feet?
kjv: [Seemeth it] a small thing unto you to have eaten up the good pasture, but ye must tread down with your feet the residue of your pastures? and to have drunk of the deep waters, but ye must foul the residue with your feet?

net: Wherever I moved throughout Israel, I did not say to any of the leaders whom I appointed to care for my people Israel,‘Why have you not built me a house made from cedar?’”’
kjv: Wheresoever I have walked with all Israel, spake I a word to any of the judges of Israel, whom I commanded to feed my people, saying, Why have ye not built me an house of cedars?

net: God wanted to make known to them the glorious riches of this mystery among the Gentiles, which is Christ in you, the hope of glory.
kjv: To whom God would make known what [is] the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles; which is Christ in you, the hope of glory:

net: “How long will you speak these things, seeing that the words of your mouth are like a great wind?
kjv: How long wilt thou speak these [things]? and [how long shall] the words of thy mouth [be like] a strong wind?

net: To each person the manifestation of the Spirit is given for the benefit of all.
kjv: But the manifestation of the Spirit is given to every man to profit withal.

net: She said,“In the past they would always say,‘Let them inquire in Abel,’ and that is how they settled things.
kjv: Then she spake, saying, They were wont to speak in old time, saying, They shall surely ask [counsel] at Abel: and so they ended [the matter].

net: if he should live a thousand years twice, yet does not enjoy his prosperity. For both of them die!
kjv: Yea, though he live a thousand years twice [told], yet hath he seen no good: do not all go to one place?

net: She said,“He gave me these sixty pounds of barley, for he said to me,‘Do not go to your mother-in-law empty-handed.’”
kjv: And she said, These six [measures] of barley gave he me; for he said to me, Go not empty unto thy mother in law.

net: So the news about him spread into all areas of the region.
kjv: And the fame of him went out into every place of the country round about.

net: You godly ones, shout for joy because of the LORD! It is appropriate for the morally upright to offer him praise.
kjv: Rejoice in the LORD, O ye righteous: [for] praise is comely for the upright.

net: The one bound to a wife should not seek divorce. The one released from a wife should not seek marriage.
kjv: Art thou bound unto a wife? seek not to be loosed. Art thou loosed from a wife? seek not a wife.

net: Just as each one has received a gift, use it to serve one another as good stewards of the varied grace of God.
kjv: As every man hath received the gift, [even so] minister the same one to another, as good stewards of the manifold grace of God.

net: Ships will come from the coast of Kittim, and will afflict Asshur, and will afflict Eber, and he will also perish forever.”
kjv: And ships [shall come] from the coast of Chittim, and shall afflict Asshur, and shall afflict Eber, and he also shall perish for ever.

net: A crowd was sitting around him and they said to him,“Look, your mother and your brothers are outside looking for you.”
kjv: And the multitude sat about him, and they said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren without seek for thee.

net: “Whoever strikes his father or his mother must surely be put to death.
kjv: And he that smiteth his father, or his mother, shall be surely put to death.

net: to be renewed in the spirit of your mind,
kjv: And be renewed in the spirit of your mind

net: It happened just as he had said to us– Pharaoh restored me to my office, but he impaled the baker.”
kjv: And it came to pass, as he interpreted to us, so it was; me he restored unto mine office, and him he hanged.

net: You know that I’ve worked for your father as hard as I could,
kjv: And ye know that with all my power I have served your father.

net: How the warriors have fallen in the midst of battle! Jonathan lies slain on your high places!
kjv: How are the mighty fallen in the midst of the battle! O Jonathan, [thou wast] slain in thine high places.

net: When the plants sprouted and produced grain, then the darnel also appeared.
kjv: ‹But when the blade was sprung up, and brought forth fruit, then appeared the tares also.›

net: The LORD will decree blessing for you with respect to your barns and in everything you do– yes, he will bless you in the land he is giving you.
kjv: The LORD shall command the blessing upon thee in thy storehouses, and in all that thou settest thine hand unto; and he shall bless thee in the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee.

net: I sent you to reap what you did not work for
kjv: ‹I sent you to reap that whereon ye bestowed no labour: other men laboured, and ye are entered into their labours.›

net: I will fulfill my vows to the LORD before all his people,
kjv: I will pay my vows unto the LORD now in the presence of all his people,

net: Pharaoh’s daughter said to her,“Yes, do so.” So the young girl went and got the child’s mother.
kjv: And Pharaoh's daughter said to her, Go. And the maid went and called the child's mother.

net: After Hezron’s death, Caleb slept with Ephrath, his father Hezron’s widow, and she bore to him Ashhur the father of Tekoa.
kjv: And after that Hezron was dead in Calebephratah, then Abiah Hezron's wife bare him Ashur the father of Tekoa.

net: Ezer was the leader, Obadiah the second in command, Eliab the third,
kjv: Ezer the first, Obadiah the second, Eliab the third,

net: When the Israelites saw that Abimelech was dead, they went home.
kjv: And when the men of Israel saw that Abimelech was dead, they departed every man unto his place.

net: Those who are in the flesh cannot please God.
kjv: So then they that are in the flesh cannot please God.

net: (22:45) Jehoshaphat was also at peace with the king of Israel.
kjv: And Jehoshaphat made peace with the king of Israel.

net: one male goat for a purification offering
kjv: One kid of the goats for a sin offering:

net: You will eat fat until you are full, and drink blood until you are drunk, at my slaughter which I have made for you.
kjv: And ye shall eat fat till ye be full, and drink blood till ye be drunken, of my sacrifice which I have sacrificed for you.

net: Like a city that is broken down and without a wall, so is a person who cannot control his temper.
kjv: He that [hath] no rule over his own spirit [is like] a city [that is] broken down, [and] without walls.

net: Blind fools! Which is greater, the gold or the temple that makes the gold sacred?
kjv: [Ye] ‹fools and blind: for whether is greater, the gold, or the temple that sanctifieth the gold?›

net: When they got near Jebus, it was getting quite late and the servant said to his master,“Come on, let’s stop at this Jebusite city and spend the night in it.”
kjv: [And] when they [were] by Jebus, the day was far spent; and the servant said unto his master, Come, I pray thee, and let us turn in into this city of the Jebusites, and lodge in it.

net: The cherubim spread their wings, and they rose up from the earth while I watched(when they went the wheels went alongside them). They stopped at the entrance to the east gate of the LORD’s temple as the glory of the God of Israel hovered above them.
kjv: And the cherubims lifted up their wings, and mounted up from the earth in my sight: when they went out, the wheels also [were] beside them, and [every one] stood at the door of the east gate of the LORD'S house; and the glory of the God of Israel [was] over them above.

net: And they began making fun of him. But he forced them all outside, and he took the child’s father and mother and his own companions and went into the room where the child was.
kjv: And they laughed him to scorn. But when he had put them all out, he taketh the father and the mother of the damsel, and them that were with him, and entereth in where the damsel was lying.

net: Because God has untied my tent cord and afflicted me, people throw off all restraint in my presence.
kjv: Because he hath loosed my cord, and afflicted me, they have also let loose the bridle before me.

net: All the people living in Jerusalem and all the people who came into Jerusalem from the towns of Judah came to observe a fast before the LORD. The fast took place in the ninth month of the fifth year that Jehoiakim son of Josiah was ruling over Judah.
kjv: And it came to pass in the fifth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah, in the ninth month, [that] they proclaimed a fast before the LORD to all the people in Jerusalem, and to all the people that came from the cities of Judah unto Jerusalem.

net: Now we know that God’s judgment is in accordance with truth against those who practice such things.
kjv: But we are sure that the judgment of God is according to truth against them which commit such things.

net: For I see that you are bitterly envious and in bondage to sin.”
kjv: For I perceive that thou art in the gall of bitterness, and [in] the bond of iniquity.

net: Asa the father of Jehoshaphat, Jehoshaphat the father of Joram, Joram the father of Uzziah,
kjv: And Asa begat Josaphat and Josaphat begat Joram

net: He asked,“What is this grave marker I see?” The men from the city replied,“It’s the grave of the prophet who came from Judah and foretold these very things you have done to the altar of Bethel.”
kjv: Then he said, What title [is] that that I see? And the men of the city told him, [It is] the sepulchre of the man of God, which came from Judah, and proclaimed these things that thou hast done against the altar of Bethel.

net: These wicked people refuse to obey what I have said. They follow the stubborn inclinations of their own hearts and pay allegiance to other gods by worshiping and serving them. So they will become just like these linen shorts which are good for nothing.
kjv: This evil people, which refuse to hear my words, which walk in the imagination of their heart, and walk after other gods, to serve them, and to worship them, shall even be as this girdle, which is good for nothing.

net: “For the Lord disciplines the one he loves and chastises every son he accepts.”
kjv: For whom the Lord loveth he chasteneth, and scourgeth every son whom he receiveth.

net: You withdrew all your fury
kjv: Thou hast taken away all thy wrath: thou hast turned [thyself] from the fierceness of thine anger.

net: “How long until you make an end of words? You must consider, and then we can talk.
kjv: How long [will it be ere] ye make an end of words? mark, and afterwards we will speak.

net: Menahem son of Gadi went up from Tirzah to Samaria and attacked Shallum son of Jabesh. He killed him and took his place as king.
kjv: For Menahem the son of Gadi went up from Tirzah, and came to Samaria, and smote Shallum the son of Jabesh in Samaria, and slew him, and reigned in his stead.

net: Exhortation to Households Wives, submit to your husbands, as is fitting in the Lord.
kjv: Wives, submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as it is fit in the Lord.

net: The elders of Jabesh said to him,“Leave us alone for seven days so that we can send messengers throughout the territory of Israel. If there is no one who can deliver us, we will come out voluntarily to you.”
kjv: And the elders of Jabesh said unto him, Give us seven days' respite, that we may send messengers unto all the coasts of Israel: and then, if [there be] no man to save us, we will come out to thee.

net: Spiritual Blessings in Christ Blessed is the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly realms in Christ.
kjv: Blessed [be] the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who hath blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly [places] in Christ:

net: Which of the trees of Eden was like you in majesty and loftiness? You will be brought down with the trees of Eden to the lower parts of the earth; you will lie among the uncircumcised, with those killed by the sword! This is what will happen to Pharaoh and all his hordes, declares the Sovereign LORD.’”
kjv: To whom art thou thus like in glory and in greatness among the trees of Eden? yet shalt thou be brought down with the trees of Eden unto the nether parts of the earth: thou shalt lie in the midst of the uncircumcised with [them that be] slain by the sword. This [is] Pharaoh and all his multitude, saith the Lord GOD.

net: “O that I could be as I was in the months now gone, in the days when God watched over me,
kjv: Oh that I were as [in] months past, as [in] the days [when] God preserved me;

net: Greet one another with a holy kiss. All the saints greet you.
kjv: Greet one another with an holy kiss. All the saints salute you.

net: The Triumphal Entry The next day the large crowd that had come to the feast heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem.
kjv: On the next day much people that were come to the feast, when they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,

net: how much more glorious will the ministry of the Spirit be?
kjv: How shall not the ministration of the spirit be rather glorious?

net: If she made the vow in her husband’s house or put herself under obligation with an oath,
kjv: And if she vowed in her husband's house, or bound her soul by a bond with an oath;

net: Peace Offering Regulations: Animal from the Herd“‘Now if his offering is a peace offering sacrifice, if he presents an offering from the herd, he must present before the LORD a flawless male or a female.
kjv: And if his oblation [be] a sacrifice of peace offering, if he offer [it] of the herd; whether [it be] a male or female, he shall offer it without blemish before the LORD.

net: He will speak words against the Most High. He will harass the holy ones of the Most High continually. His intention will be to change times established by law. They will be delivered into his hand For a time, times, and half a time.
kjv: And he shall speak [great] words against the most High, and shall wear out the saints of the most High, and think to change times and laws: and they shall be given into his hand until a time and times and the dividing of time.

net: Come! Witness the exploits of the LORD, who brings devastation to the earth!
kjv: Come, behold the works of the LORD, what desolations he hath made in the earth.

net: A Parable of Two Eagles and a Vine The LORD’s message came to me:
kjv: And the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,

net: These cities belonged to the tribe of Benjamin by its clans: Jericho, Beth Hoglah, Emek Keziz,
kjv: Now the cities of the tribe of the children of Benjamin according to their families were Jericho, and Bethhoglah, and the valley of Keziz,

net: The Babylonian soldiers that are attacking this city will break into it and set it on fire. They will burn it down along with the houses where people have made me angry by offering sacrifices to the god Baal and by pouring out drink offerings to other gods on their rooftops.
kjv: And the Chaldeans, that fight against this city, shall come and set fire on this city, and burn it with the houses, upon whose roofs they have offered incense unto Baal, and poured out drink offerings unto other gods, to provoke me to anger.

net: Healing and Forgiving a Paralytic Now on one of those days, while he was teaching, there were Pharisees and teachers of the law sitting nearby(who had come from every village of Galilee and Judea and from Jerusalem), and the power of the Lord was with him to heal.
kjv: And it came to pass on a certain day, as he was teaching, that there were Pharisees and doctors of the law sitting by, which were come out of every town of Galilee, and Judaea, and Jerusalem: and the power of the Lord was [present] to heal them.

net: Stilling of a Storm On that day, when evening came, Jesus said to his disciples,“Let’s go across to the other side of the lake.”
kjv: And the same day, when the even was come, he saith unto them, ‹Let us pass over unto the other side.›

net: So they glorified God because of me.
kjv: And they glorified God in me.

net: Five hundred men of Simeon, led by Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi, went to the hill country of Seir
kjv: And [some] of them, [even] of the sons of Simeon, five hundred men, went to mount Seir, having for their captains Pelatiah, and Neariah, and Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi.

net: Help me to understand what your precepts mean! Then I can meditate on your marvelous teachings.
kjv: Make me to understand the way of thy precepts: so shall I talk of thy wondrous works.

net: And the donkey saw the angel of the LORD standing in the road with his sword drawn in his hand, so the donkey turned aside from the road and went into the field. But Balaam beat the donkey, to make her turn back to the road.
kjv: And the ass saw the angel of the LORD standing in the way, and his sword drawn in his hand: and the ass turned aside out of the way, and went into the field: and Balaam smote the ass, to turn her into the way.

net: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
kjv: And Nogah, and Nepheg, and Japhia,

net: All this will happen because the LORD said,“The whole land will be desolate; however, I will not completely destroy it.
kjv: For thus hath the LORD said, The whole land shall be desolate; yet will I not make a full end.

net: The prophet’s attendant got up early in the morning. When he went outside there was an army surrounding the city, along with horses and chariots. He said to Elisha,“Oh no, my master! What will we do?”
kjv: And when the servant of the man of God was risen early, and gone forth, behold, an host compassed the city both with horses and chariots. And his servant said unto him, Alas, my master! how shall we do?

net: and sent out a raven
kjv: And he sent forth a raven, which went forth to and fro, until the waters were dried up from off the earth.

net: After he spent some time there, Paul left and went through the region of Galatia and Phrygia, strengthening all the disciples.
kjv: And after he had spent some time [there], he departed, and went over [all] the country of Galatia and Phrygia in order, strengthening all the disciples.

net: and I will drive you into exile beyond Damascus,” says the LORD. He is called the God of Heaven’s Armies!
kjv: Therefore will I cause you to go into captivity beyond Damascus, saith the LORD, whose name [is] The God of hosts.

net: Jesus replied,“Have I been with you for so long, and you have not known me, Philip? The person who has seen me has seen the Father! How can you say,‘Show us the Father’?
kjv: Jesus saith unto him, ‹Have I been so long time with you, and yet hast thou not known me, Philip? he that hath seen me hath seen the Father; and how sayest thou› [then], ‹Shew us the Father?›

net: Over the company of the tribe of the Asherites was Pagiel son of Ocran,
kjv: And over the host of the tribe of the children of Asher [was] Pagiel the son of Ocran.

net: So they went away by themselves in a boat to some remote place.
kjv: And they departed into a desert place by ship privately.

net: Lamech lived 595 years after he became the father of Noah, and he had other sons and daughters.
kjv: And Lamech lived after he begat Noah five hundred ninety and five years, and begat sons and daughters:

net: As David was going up the Mount of Olives, he was weeping as he went; his head was covered and his feet were bare. All the people who were with him also had their heads covered and were weeping as they went up.
kjv: And David went up by the ascent of [mount] Olivet, and wept as he went up, and had his head covered, and he went barefoot: and all the people that [was] with him covered every man his head, and they went up, weeping as they went up.

net: I will produce portents both in the sky and on the earth– blood, fire, and columns of smoke.
kjv: And I will shew wonders in the heavens and in the earth, blood, and fire, and pillars of smoke.

net: By his will we have been made holy through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all.
kjv: By the which will we are sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once [for all].

net: Moses was 120 years old when he died, but his eye was not dull nor had his vitality departed.
kjv: And Moses [was] an hundred and twenty years old when he died: his eye was not dim, nor his natural force abated.

net: And he did not do many miracles there because of their unbelief.
kjv: And he did not many mighty works there because of their unbelief.

net: Now be courageous and prove to be valiant warriors, for your lord Saul is dead. The people of Judah have anointed me as king over them.”
kjv: Therefore now let your hands be strengthened, and be ye valiant: for your master Saul is dead, and also the house of Judah have anointed me king over them.

net: So on that day I will set out to destroy all the nations that come against Jerusalem.”
kjv: And it shall come to pass in that day, [that] I will seek to destroy all the nations that come against Jerusalem.

net: and they worship me in vain, teaching as doctrines the commandments of men.’”
kjv: ‹But in vain they do worship me, teaching› [for] ‹doctrines the commandments of men.›

net: and so were James and John, Zebedee’s sons, who were Simon’s business partners. Then Jesus said to Simon,“Do not be afraid; from now on you will be catching people!”
kjv: And so [was] also James, and John, the sons of Zebedee, which were partners with Simon. And Jesus said unto Simon, ‹Fear not; from henceforth thou shalt catch men.›

net: The anger of the LORD will not turn back until he has fully carried out his intended purposes. In days to come you people will come to understand this clearly.
kjv: The anger of the LORD shall not return, until he have executed, and till he have performed the thoughts of his heart: in the latter days ye shall consider it perfectly.

net: Even your clothes are stained with the lifeblood of the poor who had not done anything wrong; you did not catch them breaking into your homes. Yet, in spite of all these things you have done,
kjv: Also in thy skirts is found the blood of the souls of the poor innocents: I have not found it by secret search, but upon all these.

net: Consequently the LORD provides safety for the oppressed
kjv: The LORD also will be a refuge for the oppressed, a refuge in times of trouble.

net: the stork, the heron after its species, the hoopoe, the bat.
kjv: And the stork, and the heron after her kind, and the lapwing, and the bat.

net: Such trials show the proven character of your faith, which is much more valuable than gold– gold that is tested by fire, even though it is passing away– and will bring praise and glory and honor when Jesus Christ is revealed.
kjv: That the trial of your faith, being much more precious than of gold that perisheth, though it be tried with fire, might be found unto praise and honour and glory at the appearing of Jesus Christ:

net: We do not see any signs of God’s presence
kjv: We see not our signs: [there is] no more any prophet: neither [is there] among us any that knoweth how long.

net: The wealth that he consumed he vomits up, God will make him throw it out of his stomach.
kjv: He hath swallowed down riches, and he shall vomit them up again: God shall cast them out of his belly.

net: Opposition to the Plan of God Afterward Moses and Aaron went to Pharaoh and said,“This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, has said,‘Release my people so that they may hold a pilgrim feast to me in the wilderness.’”
kjv: And afterward Moses and Aaron went in, and told Pharaoh, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, Let my people go, that they may hold a feast unto me in the wilderness.

net: And which of you by worrying can add even one hour to his life?
kjv: ‹Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature?›

net: You came near on the day I called to you; you said,“Do not fear!”
kjv: Thou drewest near in the day [that] I called upon thee: thou saidst, Fear not.

net: And he did die in keeping with the LORD’s message that he had spoken through Elijah. In the second year of the reign of King Jehoram son of Jehoshaphat over Judah, Ahaziah’s brother Jehoram replaced him as king of Israel, because he had no son.
kjv: So he died according to the word of the LORD which Elijah had spoken. And Jehoram reigned in his stead in the second year of Jehoram the son of Jehoshaphat king of Judah because he had no son.

net: He summoned the officers of the units of hundreds, the nobles, the rulers of the people, and all the people of the land, and he then led the king down from the LORD’s temple. They entered the royal palace through the Upper Gate and seated the king on the royal throne.
kjv: And he took the captains of hundreds, and the nobles, and the governors of the people, and all the people of the land, and brought down the king from the house of the LORD: and they came through the high gate into the king's house, and set the king upon the throne of the kingdom.

net: He rejected the tent of Joseph
kjv: Moreover he refused the tabernacle of Joseph, and chose not the tribe of Ephraim:

net: by fitting your feet with the preparation that comes from the good news of peace,
kjv: And your feet shod with the preparation of the gospel of peace

net: Those who stray morally will gain understanding
kjv: They also that erred in spirit shall come to understanding, and they that murmured shall learn doctrine.

net: And for the back of the tabernacle on the west he made six frames.
kjv: And for the sides of the tabernacle westward he made six boards.

net: None can compare to you among the gods, O Lord! Your exploits are incomparable!
kjv: Among the gods [there is] none like unto thee, O Lord; neither [are there any works] like unto thy works.

net: And all the crowds that had assembled for this spectacle, when they saw what had taken place, returned home beating their breasts.
kjv: And all the people that came together to that sight, beholding the things which were done, smote their breasts, and returned.

net: When the wicked turns from his sin and does what is just and right, he will live because of it.
kjv: But if the wicked turn from his wickedness, and do that which is lawful and right, he shall live thereby.

net: But when the sun came up, they were scorched, and because they did not have sufficient root, they withered.
kjv: ‹And when the sun was up, they were scorched; and because they had no root, they withered away.›

net: The Grateful Leper Now on the way to Jerusalem, Jesus was passing along between Samaria and Galilee.
kjv: And it came to pass, as he went to Jerusalem, that he passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee.

net: one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb in its first year, for a burnt offering;
kjv: One young bullock, one ram, one lamb of the first year, for a burnt offering:

net: The Parable of the Fig Tree“Learn this parable from the fig tree: Whenever its branch becomes tender and puts out its leaves, you know that summer is near.
kjv: ‹Now learn a parable of the fig tree; When his branch is yet tender, and putteth forth leaves, ye know that summer› [is] ‹nigh:›

net: The shackles hurt his feet; his neck was placed in an iron collar,
kjv: Whose feet they hurt with fetters: he was laid in iron:

net: The Inaccessibility and Power of God“If I go to the east, he is not there, and to the west, yet I do not perceive him.
kjv: Behold, I go forward, but he [is] not [there]; and backward, but I cannot perceive him:

net: But when Jesus discerned their innermost thoughts, he took a child, had him stand by his side,
kjv: And Jesus, perceiving the thought of their heart, took a child, and set him by him,

net: “Son of man, speak to the elders of Israel, and tell them:‘This is what the Sovereign LORD says: Are you coming to seek me? As surely as I live, I will not allow you to seek me, declares the Sovereign LORD.’
kjv: Son of man, speak unto the elders of Israel, and say unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Are ye come to enquire of me? [As] I live, saith the Lord GOD, I will not be enquired of by you.

net: Kill all her soldiers! Let them be slaughtered! They are doomed, for their day of reckoning has come, the time for them to be punished.”
kjv: Slay all her bullocks; let them go down to the slaughter: woe unto them! for their day is come, the time of their visitation.

net: Mount Zion rejoices; the towns of Judah are happy, because of your acts of judgment.
kjv: Let mount Zion rejoice, let the daughters of Judah be glad, because of thy judgments.

net: The Death of the Midianite Women But Moses was furious with the officers of the army, the commanders over thousands and commanders over hundreds, who had come from service in the war.
kjv: And Moses was wroth with the officers of the host, [with] the captains over thousands, and captains over hundreds, which came from the battle.

net: They will kill him, and on the third day he will be raised.” And they became greatly distressed.
kjv: ‹And they shall kill him, and the third day he shall be raised again.› And they were exceeding sorry.

net: When you gather together in the name of our Lord Jesus, and I am with you in spirit, along with the power of our Lord Jesus,
kjv: In the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, when ye are gathered together, and my spirit, with the power of our Lord Jesus Christ,

net: he took the seven loaves and the fish, and after giving thanks, he broke them and began giving them to the disciples, who then gave them to the crowds.
kjv: And he took the seven loaves and the fishes, and gave thanks, and brake [them], and gave to his disciples, and the disciples to the multitude.

net: Tell your daughters and neighbors,‘The LORD says,“The dead bodies of people will lie scattered everywhere like manure scattered on a field. They will lie scattered on the ground like grain that has been cut down but has not been gathered.”’”
kjv: Speak, Thus saith the LORD, Even the carcases of men shall fall as dung upon the open field, and as the handful after the harvestman, and none shall gather [them].

net: Or are we trying to provoke the Lord to jealousy? Are we really stronger than he is?
kjv: Do we provoke the Lord to jealousy? are we stronger than he?

net: The king says,“I will announce the LORD’s decree. He said to me:‘You are my son! This very day I have become your father!
kjv: I will declare the decree: the LORD hath said unto me, Thou [art] my Son; this day have I begotten thee.

net: Pour out your judgment on them! May your raging anger overtake them!
kjv: Pour out thine indignation upon them, and let thy wrathful anger take hold of them.

net: Isaac began to shake violently and asked,“Then who else hunted game and brought it to me? I ate all of it just before you arrived, and I blessed him. He will indeed be blessed!”
kjv: And Isaac trembled very exceedingly, and said, Who? where [is] he that hath taken venison, and brought [it] me, and I have eaten of all before thou camest, and have blessed him? yea, [and] he shall be blessed.

net: Prophetic Vision of the Fall of Nineveh The shields of his warriors are dyed red
kjv: The shield of his mighty men is made red, the valiant men [are] in scarlet: the chariots [shall be] with flaming torches in the day of his preparation, and the fir trees shall be terribly shaken.

net: Therefore we have been encouraged. And in addition to our own encouragement, we rejoiced even more at the joy of Titus, because all of you have refreshed his spirit.
kjv: Therefore we were comforted in your comfort: yea, and exceedingly the more joyed we for the joy of Titus, because his spirit was refreshed by you all.

net: Indeed, the coastlands look eagerly for me, the large ships are in the lead, bringing your sons from far away, along with their silver and gold, to honor the LORD your God, the Holy One of Israel, for he has bestowed honor on you.
kjv: Surely the isles shall wait for me, and the ships of Tarshish first, to bring thy sons from far, their silver and their gold with them, unto the name of the LORD thy God, and to the Holy One of Israel, because he hath glorified thee.

net: Even if Babylon climbs high into the sky and fortifies her elevated stronghold, I will send destroyers against her,” says the LORD.
kjv: Though Babylon should mount up to heaven, and though she should fortify the height of her strength, [yet] from me shall spoilers come unto her, saith the LORD.

net: He built the Upper Gate to the LORD’s temple and did a lot of work on the wall in the area known as Ophel.
kjv: He built the high gate of the house of the LORD, and on the wall of Ophel he built much.

net: The Numbering of Merari From Merari came the family of the Mahlites and the family of the Mushites
kjv: Of Merari [was] the family of the Mahlites, and the family of the Mushites: these [are] the families of Merari.

net: So he took David down, and they found them spread out over the land. They were eating and drinking and enjoying themselves because of all the loot they had taken from the land of the Philistines and from the land of Judah.
kjv: And when he had brought him down, behold, [they were] spread abroad upon all the earth, eating and drinking, and dancing, because of all the great spoil that they had taken out of the land of the Philistines, and out of the land of Judah.

net: All those numbered of the camp of Reuben, according to their divisions, are 151,450. They will travel second.
kjv: All that were numbered in the camp of Reuben [were] an hundred thousand and fifty and one thousand and four hundred and fifty, throughout their armies. And they shall set forth in the second rank.

net: and led Israel through its midst, for his loyal love endures,
kjv: And made Israel to pass through the midst of it: for his mercy [endureth] for ever:

net: I will make the land desolate because they have acted unfaithfully, declares the Sovereign LORD.”
kjv: And I will make the land desolate, because they have committed a trespass, saith the Lord GOD.

net: For everything made visible is light, and for this reason it says:“Awake, O sleeper! Rise from the dead, and Christ will shine on you!”
kjv: Wherefore he saith, Awake thou that sleepest, and arise from the dead, and Christ shall give thee light.

net: and provide mounts for Paul to ride so that he may be brought safely to Felix the governor.”
kjv: And provide [them] beasts, that they may set Paul on, and bring [him] safe unto Felix the governor.
