net: and in the presence of his colleagues and the army of Samaria he said,“What are these feeble Jews doing? Will they be left to themselves? Will they again offer sacrifice? Will they finish this in a day? Can they bring these burnt stones to life again from piles of dust?”
kjv: And he spake before his brethren and the army of Samaria, and said, What do these feeble Jews? will they fortify themselves? will they sacrifice? will they make an end in a day? will they revive the stones out of the heaps of the rubbish which are burned?

net: because the tribe of the Reubenites by their families, the tribe of the Gadites by their families, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have received their inheritance.
kjv: For the tribe of the children of Reuben according to the house of their fathers, and the tribe of the children of Gad according to the house of their fathers, have received [their inheritance]; and half the tribe of Manasseh have received their inheritance:

net: Solomon laid the foundation for God’s temple; its length(determined according to the old standard of measure) was 90 feet, and its width 30 feet.
kjv: Now these [are the things wherein] Solomon was instructed for the building of the house of God. The length by cubits after the first measure [was] threescore cubits, and the breadth twenty cubits.

net: I reflected on everything that is accomplished by man on earth, and I concluded: Everything he has accomplished is futile– like chasing the wind!
kjv: I have seen all the works that are done under the sun; and, behold, all [is] vanity and vexation of spirit.

net: Meshezabel, Zadok, Jaddua,
kjv: Meshezabeel, Zadok, Jaddua,

net: The sun will be changed to darkness and the moon to blood before the great and glorious day of the Lord comes.
kjv: The sun shall be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before that great and notable day of the Lord come:

net: You must not hate an Edomite, for he is your relative; you must not hate an Egyptian, for you lived as a foreigner in his land.
kjv: Thou shalt not abhor an Edomite for he [is] thy brother: thou shalt not abhor an Egyptian

net: Jeremiah is Charged with Deserting, Arrested, and Imprisoned The following events also occurred while the Babylonian forces had temporarily withdrawn from Jerusalem because the army of Pharaoh was coming.
kjv: And it came to pass, that when the army of the Chaldeans was broken up from Jerusalem for fear of Pharaoh's army,

net: The backslider will be paid back from his own ways, but a good person will be rewarded for his.
kjv: The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways: and a good man [shall be satisfied] from himself.

net: There were no restrictions on the drinking, for the king had instructed all of his supervisors that they should do as everyone so desired.
kjv: And the drinking [was] according to the law; none did compel: for so the king had appointed to all the officers of his house, that they should do according to every man's pleasure.

net: It could have been sold for more than three hundred silver coins and the money given to the poor!” So they spoke angrily to her.
kjv: For it might have been sold for more than three hundred pence, and have been given to the poor. And they murmured against her.

net: Then he brought them outside and asked,“Sirs, what must I do to be saved?”
kjv: And brought them out, and said, Sirs, what must I do to be saved?

net: If I have sinned– what have I done to you, O watcher of men? Why have you set me as your target? Have I become a burden to you?
kjv: I have sinned; what shall I do unto thee, O thou preserver of men? why hast thou set me as a mark against thee, so that I am a burden to myself?

net: Honesty has disappeared; the one who tries to avoid evil is robbed. The LORD watches and is displeased, for there is no justice.
kjv: Yea, truth faileth; and he [that] departeth from evil maketh himself a prey: and the LORD saw [it], and it displeased him that [there was] no judgment.

net: Then he brought me by way of the north gate to the front of the temple. As I watched, I noticed the glory of the LORD filling the LORD’s temple, and I threw myself face down.
kjv: Then brought he me the way of the north gate before the house: and I looked, and, behold, the glory of the LORD filled the house of the LORD: and I fell upon my face.

net: You study the scriptures thoroughly because you think in them you possess eternal life, and it is these same scriptures that testify about me,
kjv: ‹Search the scriptures for in them ye think ye have eternal life: and they are they which testify of me.›

net: You saw the many breaks in the walls of the City of David
kjv: Ye have seen also the breaches of the city of David, that they are many: and ye gathered together the waters of the lower pool.

net: How often are they like straw before the wind, and like chaff swept away by a whirlwind?
kjv: They are as stubble before the wind, and as chaff that the storm carrieth away.

net: Shebuel son of Gershom, the son of Moses, was the supervisor of the storehouses.
kjv: And Shebuel the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, [was] ruler of the treasures.

net: If they want to find out about something, they should ask their husbands at home, because it is disgraceful for a woman to speak in church.
kjv: And if they will learn any thing, let them ask their husbands at home: for it is a shame for women to speak in the church.

net: You thoroughly defeated Edom and it has gone to your head! Gloat over your success, but stay in your palace. Why bring calamity on yourself? Why bring down yourself and Judah along with you?”
kjv: Thou hast indeed smitten Edom, and thine heart hath lifted thee up: glory [of this], and tarry at home: for why shouldest thou meddle to [thy] hurt, that thou shouldest fall, [even] thou, and Judah with thee?

net: For King Zedekiah had confined Jeremiah there after he had reproved him for prophesying as he did. He had asked Jeremiah,“Why do you keep prophesying these things? Why do you keep saying that the LORD says,‘I will hand this city over to the king of Babylon? I will let him capture it.
kjv: For Zedekiah king of Judah had shut him up, saying, Wherefore dost thou prophesy, and say, Thus saith the LORD, Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall take it;

net: Models for Ministry Now I hope in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy to you soon, so that I too may be encouraged by hearing news about you.
kjv: But I trust in the Lord Jesus to send Timotheus shortly unto you, that I also may be of good comfort, when I know your state.

net: Then a round lead cover was raised up, revealing a woman sitting inside the basket.
kjv: And, behold, there was lifted up a talent of lead: and this [is] a woman that sitteth in the midst of the ephah.

net: Your tongue carries out your destructive plans; it is as effective as a sharp razor, O deceiver.
kjv: Thy tongue deviseth mischiefs; like a sharp razor, working deceitfully.

net: The Approach to Moab The Israelites traveled on and camped in Oboth.
kjv: And the children of Israel set forward, and pitched in Oboth.

net: For the eyes of the Lord are upon the righteous and his ears are open to their prayer. But the Lord’s face is against those who do evil.
kjv: For the eyes of the Lord [are] over the righteous, and his ears [are open] unto their prayers: but the face of the Lord [is] against them that do evil.

net: When the old prophet who had invited him to his house heard the news, he said,“It is the prophet who rebelled against the LORD. The LORD delivered him over to the lion and it tore him up and killed him, in keeping with the LORD’S message that he had spoken to him.”
kjv: And when the prophet that brought him back from the way heard [thereof], he said, It [is] the man of God, who was disobedient unto the word of the LORD: therefore the LORD hath delivered him unto the lion, which hath torn him, and slain him, according to the word of the LORD, which he spake unto him.

net: They put the ark of the LORD on the cart, along with the chest, the gold mice, and the images of the sores.
kjv: And they laid the ark of the LORD upon the cart, and the coffer with the mice of gold and the images of their emerods.

net: A kind person benefits himself, but a cruel person brings himself trouble.
kjv: The merciful man doeth good to his own soul: but [he that is] cruel troubleth his own flesh.

net: The Description of Leviathan(40:25)“Can you pull in Leviathan with a hook, and tie down its tongue with a rope?
kjv: Canst thou draw out leviathan with an hook? or his tongue with a cord [which] thou lettest down?

net: My harp is used for mourning and my flute for the sound of weeping.
kjv: My harp also is [turned] to mourning, and my organ into the voice of them that weep.

net: The men of Ephraim did not conquer the Canaanites living in Gezer. The Canaanites lived among them in Gezer.
kjv: Neither did Ephraim drive out the Canaanites that dwelt in Gezer but the Canaanites dwelt in Gezer among them.

net: because these are days of vengeance, to fulfill all that is written.
kjv: ‹For these be the days of vengeance, that all things which are written may be fulfilled.›

net: He said to me,“Son of man, go to the house of Israel and speak my words to them.
kjv: And he said unto me, Son of man, go, get thee unto the house of Israel, and speak with my words unto them.

net: Future Repentance and Restoration of Israel However, in the future I will allure her; I will lead her back into the wilderness, and speak tenderly to her.
kjv: Therefore, behold, I will allure her, and bring her into the wilderness, and speak comfortably unto her.

net: When David was told what Rizpah daughter of Aiah, Saul’s concubine, had done,
kjv: And it was told David what Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, the concubine of Saul, had done.

net: “All the best of the olive oil and all the best of the wine and of the wheat, the first fruits of these things that they give to the LORD, I have given to you.
kjv: All the best of the oil, and all the best of the wine, and of the wheat, the firstfruits of them which they shall offer unto the LORD, them have I given thee.

net: My beloved is like a fragrant pouch of myrrh spending the night between my breasts.
kjv: A bundle of myrrh [is] my wellbeloved unto me he shall lie all night betwixt my breasts.

net: everyone who belongs to me, whom I created for my glory, whom I formed– yes, whom I made!
kjv: [Even] every one that is called by my name: for I have created him for my glory, I have formed him; yea, I have made him.

net: Like a vine he will let his sour grapes fall, and like an olive tree he will shed his blossoms.
kjv: He shall shake off his unripe grape as the vine, and shall cast off his flower as the olive.

net: The rest of the events of Jotham’s reign, including all his military campaigns and his accomplishments, are recorded in the scroll of the kings of Israel and Judah.
kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Jotham, and all his wars, and his ways, lo, they [are] written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah.

net: The prophet asked,“Where did it drop in?” When he showed him the spot, Elisha cut off a branch, threw it in at that spot, and made the ax head float.
kjv: And the man of God said, Where fell it? And he shewed him the place. And he cut down a stick, and cast [it] in thither; and the iron did swim.

net: He sent them to Bethlehem and said,“Go and look carefully for the child. When you find him, inform me so that I can go and worship him as well.”
kjv: And he sent them to Bethlehem, and said, Go and search diligently for the young child; and when ye have found [him], bring me word again, that I may come and worship him also.

net: in order to protect him from times of trouble, until the wicked are destroyed.
kjv: That thou mayest give him rest from the days of adversity, until the pit be digged for the wicked.

net: The Turning Point: The King Honors Mordecai Throughout that night the king was unable to sleep, so he asked for the book containing the historical records to be brought. As the records were being read in the king’s presence,
kjv: On that night could not the king sleep, and he commanded to bring the book of records of the chronicles; and they were read before the king.

net: She extended her hands to the spool, and her hands grasped the spindle.
kjv: She layeth her hands to the spindle, and her hands hold the distaff.

net: You do not deliver me over to the power of the enemy
kjv: And hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy: thou hast set my feet in a large room.

net: Take a man’s garment when he has given security for a stranger, and hold him in pledge on behalf of a stranger.
kjv: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger, and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.

net: and he begins to beat his fellow slaves and to eat and drink with drunkards,
kjv: ‹And shall begin to smite› [his] ‹fellowservants, and to eat and drink with the drunken;›

net: Then Judah said to his father Israel,“Send the boy with me and we will go immediately. Then we will live and not die– we and you and our little ones.
kjv: And Judah said unto Israel his father, Send the lad with me, and we will arise and go; that we may live, and not die, both we, and thou, [and] also our little ones.

net: However, King Jehoiakim sent some men to Egypt, including Elnathan son of Achbor,
kjv: And Jehoiakim the king sent men into Egypt, [namely], Elnathan the son of Achbor, and [certain] men with him into Egypt.

net: If a man gives his neighbor a donkey or an ox or a sheep or any beast to keep, and it dies or is injured or is carried away without anyone seeing it,
kjv: If a man deliver unto his neighbour an ass, or an ox, or a sheep, or any beast, to keep; and it die, or be hurt, or driven away, no man seeing [it]:

net: The evergreens also rejoice over your demise, as do the cedars of Lebanon, singing,‘Since you fell asleep, no woodsman comes up to chop us down!’
kjv: Yea, the fir trees rejoice at thee, [and] the cedars of Lebanon, [saying], Since thou art laid down, no feller is come up against us.

net: Eleoenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah,
kjv: And Elioenai, and Jaakobah, and Jeshohaiah, and Asaiah, and Adiel, and Jesimiel, and Benaiah,

net: From the descendants of Manasseh: According to the records of their clans and families, all the males twenty years old or older who could serve in the army were listed by name.
kjv: Of the children of Manasseh, by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go forth to war;

net: The young woman ran and told her mother’s household all about these things.
kjv: And the damsel ran, and told [them of] her mother's house these things.

net: So the saying circulated among the brothers and sisters that this disciple was not going to die. But Jesus did not say to him that he was not going to die, but rather,“If I want him to live until I come back, what concern is that of yours?”
kjv: Then went this saying abroad among the brethren, that that disciple should not die: yet Jesus said not unto him, He shall not die; but, If I will that he tarry till I come, what [is that] to thee?

net: His servants conspired against him and killed him in his palace.
kjv: And his servants conspired against him, and slew him in his own house.

net: He will retain one tribe, for my servant David’s sake and for the sake of Jerusalem, the city I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel.
kjv: (But he shall have one tribe for my servant David's sake, and for Jerusalem's sake, the city which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel:)

net: Shout out, daughter of Gallim! Pay attention, Laishah! Answer her, Anathoth!
kjv: Lift up thy voice, O daughter of Gallim: cause it to be heard unto Laish, O poor Anathoth.

net: A Case of Blaspheming the Name Now an Israelite woman’s son whose father was an Egyptian went out among the Israelites, and the Israelite woman’s son and an Israelite man had a fight in the camp.
kjv: And the son of an Israelitish woman, whose father [was] an Egyptian, went out among the children of Israel: and this son of the Israelitish [woman] and a man of Israel strove together in the camp;

net: Patience in Suffering So be patient, brothers and sisters, until the Lord’s return. Think of how the farmer waits for the precious fruit of the ground and is patient for it until it receives the early and late rains.
kjv: Be patient therefore, brethren, unto the coming of the Lord. Behold, the husbandman waiteth for the precious fruit of the earth, and hath long patience for it, until he receive the early and latter rain.

net: treacherous, reckless, conceited, loving pleasure rather than loving God.
kjv: Traitors, heady, highminded, lovers of pleasures more than lovers of God;

net: But at his gate lay a poor man named Lazarus whose body was covered with sores,
kjv: ‹And there was a certain beggar named Lazarus, which was laid at his gate, full of sores,›

net: Shimei said to the king,“My master the king’s proposal is acceptable. Your servant will do as you say.” So Shimei lived in Jerusalem for a long time.
kjv: And Shimei said unto the king, The saying [is] good: as my lord the king hath said, so will thy servant do. And Shimei dwelt in Jerusalem many days.

net: The Song of Triumph Then Moses and the Israelites sang this song to the LORD. They said,“I will sing to the LORD, for he has triumphed gloriously, the horse and its rider he has thrown into the sea.
kjv: Then sang Moses and the children of Israel this song unto the LORD, and spake, saying, I will sing unto the LORD, for he hath triumphed gloriously: the horse and his rider hath he thrown into the sea.

net: The horn that was broken and in whose place there arose four others stands for four kingdoms that will arise from his nation, though they will not have his strength.
kjv: Now that being broken, whereas four stood up for it, four kingdoms shall stand up out of the nation, but not in his power.

net: They traveled from Marah and came to Elim; in Elim there are twelve fountains of water and seventy palm trees, so they camped there.
kjv: And they removed from Marah, and came unto Elim: and in Elim [were] twelve fountains of water, and threescore and ten palm trees; and they pitched there.

net: No one will use any of your stones as a cornerstone. No one will use any of them in the foundation of his house. For you will lie desolate forever,” says the LORD.
kjv: And they shall not take of thee a stone for a corner, nor a stone for foundations; but thou shalt be desolate for ever, saith the LORD.

net: But the LORD hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he was not willing to release them.
kjv: But the LORD hardened Pharaoh's heart, and he would not let them go.

net: Now the dragon’s tail swept away a third of the stars in heaven and hurled them to the earth. Then the dragon stood before the woman who was about to give birth, so that he might devour her child as soon as it was born.
kjv: And his tail drew the third part of the stars of heaven, and did cast them to the earth: and the dragon stood before the woman which was ready to be delivered, for to devour her child as soon as it was born.

net: Aaron’s Death So the entire company of Israelites traveled from Kadesh and came to Mount Hor.
kjv: And the children of Israel, [even] the whole congregation, journeyed from Kadesh, and came unto mount Hor.

net: in case I am delayed, to let you know how people ought to conduct themselves in the household of God, because it is the church of the living God, the support and bulwark of the truth.
kjv: But if I tarry long, that thou mayest know how thou oughtest to behave thyself in the house of God, which is the church of the living God, the pillar and ground of the truth.

net: And you became imitators of us and of the Lord, when you received the message with joy that comes from the Holy Spirit, despite great affliction.
kjv: And ye became followers of us, and of the Lord, having received the word in much affliction, with joy of the Holy Ghost:

net: I saw an amber glow like a fire enclosed all around from his waist up. From his waist down I saw something that looked like fire. There was a brilliant light around it,
kjv: And I saw as the colour of amber, as the appearance of fire round about within it, from the appearance of his loins even upward, and from the appearance of his loins even downward, I saw as it were the appearance of fire, and it had brightness round about.

net: Jesus answered,“You unbelieving and perverse generation! How much longer must I be with you? How much longer must I endure you? Bring him here to me.”
kjv: Then Jesus answered and said, ‹O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you? how long shall I suffer you? bring him hither to me.›

net: Jesus said to him,“I tell you the truth, today– this very night– before a rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.”
kjv: And Jesus saith unto him, ‹Verily I say unto thee, That this day,› [even] ‹in this night, before the cock crow twice, thou shalt deny me thrice.›

net: This is what Hezekiah did throughout Judah. He did what the LORD his God considered good and right and faithful.
kjv: And thus did Hezekiah throughout all Judah, and wrought [that which was] good and right and truth before the LORD his God.

net: He said to me,“Son of man, eat what you see in front of you– eat this scroll– and then go and speak to the house of Israel.”
kjv: Moreover he said unto me, Son of man, eat that thou findest; eat this roll, and go speak unto the house of Israel.

net: “Treat fairly the sons of Barzillai of Gilead and provide for their needs, because they helped me when I had to flee from your brother Absalom.
kjv: But shew kindness unto the sons of Barzillai the Gileadite, and let them be of those that eat at thy table: for so they came to me when I fled because of Absalom thy brother.

net: Every valley must be elevated, and every mountain and hill leveled. The rough terrain will become a level plain, the rugged landscape a wide valley.
kjv: Every valley shall be exalted, and every mountain and hill shall be made low: and the crooked shall be made straight, and the rough places plain:

net: He wisely placed some of his many sons throughout the regions of Judah and Benjamin in the various fortified cities. He supplied them with abundant provisions and acquired many wives for them.
kjv: And he dealt wisely, and dispersed of all his children throughout all the countries of Judah and Benjamin, unto every fenced city: and he gave them victual in abundance. And he desired many wives.

net: Individuals Are Challenged to Put Their Trust in the Lord The LORD says,“I will put a curse on people who trust in mere human beings, who depend on mere flesh and blood for their strength, and whose hearts have turned away from the LORD.
kjv: Thus saith the LORD; Cursed [be] the man that trusteth in man, and maketh flesh his arm, and whose heart departeth from the LORD.

net: For it is right for God to repay with affliction those who afflict you,
kjv: Seeing [it is] a righteous thing with God to recompense tribulation to them that trouble you

net: The seven priests carrying the seven rams’ horns before the ark of the LORD marched along blowing their horns. Armed troops marched ahead of them, while the rear guard followed along behind the ark of the LORD blowing rams’ horns.
kjv: And seven priests bearing seven trumpets of rams' horns before the ark of the LORD went on continually, and blew with the trumpets: and the armed men went before them; but the rereward came after the ark of the LORD, [the priests] going on, and blowing with the trumpets.

net: Remaining Unmarried With regard to the question about people who have never married, I have no command from the Lord, but I give my opinion as one shown mercy by the Lord to be trustworthy.
kjv: Now concerning virgins I have no commandment of the Lord: yet I give my judgment, as one that hath obtained mercy of the Lord to be faithful.

net: So they went back and told him. Then he said,“It is the fulfillment of the LORD’s message that he had spoken through his servant, Elijah the Tishbite,‘In the plot of land at Jezreel, dogs will devour Jezebel’s flesh.
kjv: Wherefore they came again, and told him. And he said, This [is] the word of the LORD, which he spake by his servant Elijah the Tishbite, saying, In the portion of Jezreel shall dogs eat the flesh of Jezebel:

net: Then we took their land and gave it as an inheritance to Reuben, Gad, and half the tribe of Manasseh.
kjv: And we took their land, and gave it for an inheritance unto the Reubenites, and to the Gadites, and to the half tribe of Manasseh.

net: For everyone who asks receives, and the one who seeks finds, and to the one who knocks, the door will be opened.
kjv: ‹For every one that asketh receiveth and he that seeketh findeth

net: He answered them,“What did Moses command you?”
kjv: And he answered and said unto them, ‹What did Moses command you?›

net: Jerahmeel’s Descendants The sons of Jerahmeel, Hezron’s firstborn, were Ram, the firstborn, Bunah, Oren, Ozem, and Ahijah.
kjv: And the sons of Jerahmeel the firstborn of Hezron were, Ram the firstborn, and Bunah, and Oren, and Ozem, [and] Ahijah.

net: Then the LORD again appeared in Shiloh, for it was in Shiloh that the LORD had revealed himself to Samuel through a message from the LORD.
kjv: And the LORD appeared again in Shiloh: for the LORD revealed himself to Samuel in Shiloh by the word of the LORD.

net: An elder must be blameless, the husband of one wife, with faithful children who cannot be charged with dissipation or rebellion.
kjv: If any be blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children not accused of riot or unruly.

net: You are to make two cherubim of gold
kjv: And thou shalt make two cherubims [of] gold, [of] beaten work shalt thou make them, in the two ends of the mercy seat.

net: I will rescue you from your own people and from the Gentiles, to whom I am sending you
kjv: ‹Delivering thee from the people, and› [from] ‹the Gentiles, unto whom now I send thee,›

net: The sons of Shobal, the father of Kiriath Jearim, were Haroeh, half of the Manahathites,
kjv: And Shobal the father of Kirjathjearim had sons; Haroeh, [and] half of the Manahethites.

net: to James and his brother John, the sons of Zebedee, he gave the name Boanerges(that is,“sons of thunder”);
kjv: And James the [son] of Zebedee, and John the brother of James; and he surnamed them Boanerges, which is, The sons of thunder:

net: The one who goes about slandering others reveals secrets, but the one who is trustworthy conceals a matter.
kjv: A talebearer revealeth secrets: but he that is of a faithful spirit concealeth the matter.

net: who was formerly useless to you, but is now useful to you and me.
kjv: Which in time past was to thee unprofitable, but now profitable to thee and to me:

net: When the Canaanites and all who live in the land hear about this, they will turn against us and destroy the very memory of us from the earth. What will you do to protect your great reputation?”
kjv: For the Canaanites and all the inhabitants of the land shall hear [of it], and shall environ us round, and cut off our name from the earth: and what wilt thou do unto thy great name?

net: “I(says the LORD) will strengthen the kingdom of Judah and deliver the people of Joseph and will bring them back because of my compassion for them. They will be as though I had never rejected them, for I am the LORD their God and therefore I will hear them.
kjv: And I will strengthen the house of Judah, and I will save the house of Joseph, and I will bring them again to place them; for I have mercy upon them: and they shall be as though I had not cast them off: for I [am] the LORD their God, and will hear them.

net: So Jesus said again,“I tell you the solemn truth, I am the door for the sheep.
kjv: Then said Jesus unto them again, ‹Verily, verily, I say unto you, I am the door of the sheep.›

net: God’s questions to Job“Where were you when I laid the foundation of the earth? Tell me, if you possess understanding!
kjv: Where wast thou when I laid the foundations of the earth? declare, if thou hast understanding.

net: “Woe to you, experts in the law and you Pharisees, hypocrites! You give a tenth of mint, dill, and cumin, yet you neglect what is more important in the law– justice, mercy, and faithfulness! You should have done these things without neglecting the others.
kjv: ‹Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye pay tithe of mint and anise and cummin, and have omitted the weightier› [matters] ‹of the law, judgment, mercy, and faith: these ought ye to have done, and not to leave the other undone.›

net: Praise the LORD! Praise the LORD, O my soul!
kjv: Praise ye the LORD. Praise the LORD, O my soul.

net: A man who was from there replied,“And who is their father?” Therefore this became a proverb:“Is even Saul among the prophets?”
kjv: And one of the same place answered and said, But who [is] their father? Therefore it became a proverb, [Is] Saul also among the prophets?

net: And now when you eat and drink, are you not doing so for yourselves?’”
kjv: And when ye did eat, and when ye did drink, did not ye eat [for yourselves], and drink [for yourselves]?

net: Correct us, LORD, but only in due measure. Do not punish us in anger or you will reduce us to nothing.
kjv: O LORD, correct me, but with judgment; not in thine anger, lest thou bring me to nothing.

net: It must be eaten on the day of your sacrifice and on the following day, but what is left over until the third day must be burned up.
kjv: It shall be eaten the same day ye offer it, and on the morrow: and if ought remain until the third day, it shall be burnt in the fire.

net: The Israelites followed the LORD’s instructions to Moses and divided up the land.
kjv: As the LORD commanded Moses, so the children of Israel did, and they divided the land.

net: He did this because David had done what he approved and had not disregarded any of his commandments his entire lifetime, except for the incident involving Uriah the Hittite.
kjv: Because David did [that which was] right in the eyes of the LORD, and turned not aside from any [thing] that he commanded him all the days of his life, save only in the matter of Uriah the Hittite.

net: then whoever owns the house must come and declare to the priest,‘Something like an infection is visible to me in the house.’
kjv: And he that owneth the house shall come and tell the priest, saying, It seemeth to me [there is] as it were a plague in the house:

net: For Adam was formed first and then Eve.
kjv: For Adam was first formed, then Eve.

net: in hope of eternal life, which God, who does not lie, promised before time began.
kjv: In hope of eternal life, which God, that cannot lie, promised before the world began;

net: They demolished the sacred pillar of Baal and the temple of Baal
kjv: And they brake down the image of Baal, and brake down the house of Baal, and made it a draught house unto this day.

net: Every grain offering which is baked in the oven or made in the pan or on the griddle belongs to the priest who presented it.
kjv: And all the meat offering that is baken in the oven, and all that is dressed in the fryingpan, and in the pan, shall be the priest's that offereth it.

net: So Manoah got up and followed his wife. When he met the man, he said to him,“Are you the man who spoke to my wife?” He said,“Yes.”
kjv: And Manoah arose, and went after his wife, and came to the man, and said unto him, [Art] thou the man that spakest unto the woman? And he said, I [am].

net: When David went home to pronounce a blessing on his own house, Michal, Saul’s daughter, came out to meet him. She said,“How the king of Israel has distinguished himself this day! He has exposed himself today before his servants’ slave girls the way a vulgar fool might do!”
kjv: Then David returned to bless his household. And Michal the daughter of Saul came out to meet David, and said, How glorious was the king of Israel to day, who uncovered himself to day in the eyes of the handmaids of his servants, as one of the vain fellows shamelessly uncovereth himself!

net: The standard of the camp of the Judahites set out first according to their companies, and over his company was Nahshon son of Amminadab.
kjv: In the first [place] went the standard of the camp of the children of Judah according to their armies: and over his host [was] Nahshon the son of Amminadab.

net: They say,“Let him hurry, let him act quickly, so we can see; let the plan of the Holy One of Israel take shape and come to pass, then we will know it!”
kjv: That say, Let him make speed, [and] hasten his work, that we may see [it]: and let the counsel of the Holy One of Israel draw nigh and come, that we may know [it]!

net: He remembered his covenant with them, and relented because of his great loyal love.
kjv: And he remembered for them his covenant, and repented according to the multitude of his mercies.

net: For if after they have escaped the filthy things of the world through the rich knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, they again get entangled in them and succumb to them, their last state has become worse for them than their first.
kjv: For if after they have escaped the pollutions of the world through the knowledge of the Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ, they are again entangled therein, and overcome, the latter end is worse with them than the beginning.

net: We are witnesses of all the things he did both in Judea and in Jerusalem. They killed him by hanging him on a tree,
kjv: And we are witnesses of all things which he did both in the land of the Jews, and in Jerusalem; whom they slew and hanged on a tree:

net: I placed you there with an anointed guardian cherub
kjv: Thou [art] the anointed cherub that covereth and I have set thee [so]: thou wast upon the holy mountain of God

net: Now after you another kingdom will arise, one inferior to yours. Then a third kingdom, one of bronze, will rule in all the earth.
kjv: And after thee shall arise another kingdom inferior to thee, and another third kingdom of brass, which shall bear rule over all the earth.

net: In addition, they also killed Parshandatha, Dalphon, Aspatha,
kjv: And Parshandatha, and Dalphon, and Aspatha,

net: Manoah prayed to the LORD,“Please, Lord, allow the man sent from God to visit us again, so he can teach us how we should raise the child who will be born.”
kjv: Then Manoah intreated the LORD, and said, O my Lord, let the man of God which thou didst send come again unto us, and teach us what we shall do unto the child that shall be born.

net: Isaac’s Descendants Abraham was the father of Isaac. The sons of Isaac:Esau and Israel.
kjv: And Abraham begat Isaac. The sons of Isaac Esau and Israel.

net: Moses went up to God, and the LORD called to him from the mountain,“Thus you will tell the house of Jacob, and declare to the people of Israel:
kjv: And Moses went up unto God, and the LORD called unto him out of the mountain, saying, Thus shalt thou say to the house of Jacob, and tell the children of Israel;

net: But I would strengthen you with my words
kjv: [But] I would strengthen you with my mouth, and the moving of my lips should asswage [your grief].

net: The rest of the events of Uzziah’s reign, from start to finish, were recorded by the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz.
kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Uzziah, first and last, did Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, write.

net: The LORD told my father David,‘It is right for you to have a strong desire to build a temple to honor me.
kjv: And the LORD said unto David my father, Whereas it was in thine heart to build an house unto my name, thou didst well that it was in thine heart.

net: Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took a hand-drum in her hand, and all the women went out after her with hand-drums and with dances.
kjv: And Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took a timbrel in her hand; and all the women went out after her with timbrels and with dances.

net: a lion, mightiest of the beasts, who does not retreat from anything;
kjv: A lion [which is] strongest among beasts, and turneth not away for any;

net: So,” the Sovereign LORD says,“my raging fury will be poured out on this land. It will be poured out on human beings and animals, on trees and crops. And it will burn like a fire which cannot be extinguished.”
kjv: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, mine anger and my fury shall be poured out upon this place, upon man, and upon beast, and upon the trees of the field, and upon the fruit of the ground; and it shall burn, and shall not be quenched.

net: Keep my commands so that you may live, and obey my instruction as your most prized possession.
kjv: Keep my commandments, and live; and my law as the apple of thine eye.

net: She said,“I will indeed go with you. But you will not gain fame on the expedition you are undertaking, for the LORD will turn Sisera over to a woman.” Deborah got up and went with Barak to Kedesh.
kjv: And she said, I will surely go with thee: notwithstanding the journey that thou takest shall not be for thine honour; for the LORD shall sell Sisera into the hand of a woman. And Deborah arose, and went with Barak to Kedesh.

net: Do you intend to criticize mere words, and treat the words of a despairing man as wind?
kjv: Do ye imagine to reprove words, and the speeches of one that is desperate, [which are] as wind?

net: She said,“My lord. Just as surely as you are alive, my lord, I am the woman who previously stood here with you in order to pray to the LORD.
kjv: And she said, Oh my lord, [as] thy soul liveth, my lord, I [am] the woman that stood by thee here, praying unto the LORD.

net: Jesus replied,“Everyone who drinks some of this water will be thirsty again.
kjv: Jesus answered and said unto her, ‹Whosoever drinketh of this water shall thirst again:›

net: As Obadiah was traveling along, Elijah met him. When he recognized him, he fell facedown to the ground and said,“Is it really you, my master, Elijah?”
kjv: And as Obadiah was in the way, behold, Elijah met him: and he knew him, and fell on his face, and said, [Art] thou that my lord Elijah?

net: So David and his men went on their way. But Shimei kept going along the side of the hill opposite him, yelling curses as he threw stones and dirt at them.
kjv: And as David and his men went by the way, Shimei went along on the hill's side over against him, and cursed as he went, and threw stones at him, and cast dust.

net: They assembled their brothers and consecrated themselves. Then they went in to purify the LORD’s temple, just as the king had ordered, in accordance with the word of the LORD.
kjv: And they gathered their brethren, and sanctified themselves, and came, according to the commandment of the king, by the words of the LORD, to cleanse the house of the LORD.

net: The Ministry of John the Baptist In those days John the Baptist came into the wilderness of Judea proclaiming,
kjv: In those days came John the Baptist, preaching in the wilderness of Judaea,

net: To the Church in Smyrna“To the angel of the church in Smyrna write the following:“This is the solemn pronouncement of the one who is the first and the last, the one who was dead, but came to life:
kjv: ‹And unto the angel of the church in Smyrna write; These things saith the first and the last, which was dead, and is alive;›

net: when he comes to be glorified among his saints and admired on that day among all who have believed– and you did in fact believe our testimony.
kjv: When he shall come to be glorified in his saints, and to be admired in all them that believe (because our testimony among you was believed) in that day.

net: “Blessed are the meek, for they will inherit the earth.
kjv: ‹Blessed› [are] ‹the meek: for they shall inherit the earth.›

net: Better Days Ahead for Jerusalem In the future the LORD’s Temple Mount will be the most important mountain of all
kjv: But in the last days it shall come to pass, [that] the mountain of the house of the LORD shall be established in the top of the mountains, and it shall be exalted above the hills; and people shall flow unto it.

net: The LORD God of Israel deserves praise in the future and forevermore! We agree! We agree!
kjv: Blessed [be] the LORD God of Israel from everlasting, and to everlasting. Amen, and Amen.

net: Zadok the priest took a horn filled with olive oil from the tent and poured it on Solomon; the trumpet was blown and all the people declared,“Long live King Solomon!”
kjv: And Zadok the priest took an horn of oil out of the tabernacle, and anointed Solomon. And they blew the trumpet; and all the people said, God save king Solomon.

net: Whenever you enter a house, first say,‘May peace be on this house!’
kjv: ‹And into whatsoever house ye enter, first say, Peace› [be] ‹to this house.›

net: Year after year visitors brought their gifts, which included items of silver, items of gold, clothes, perfume, spices, horses, and mules.
kjv: And they brought every man his present, vessels of silver, and vessels of gold, and raiment, harness, and spices, horses, and mules, a rate year by year.

net: When Pharaoh’s officials saw her, they praised her to Pharaoh. So Abram’s wife was taken into the household of Pharaoh,
kjv: The princes also of Pharaoh saw her, and commended her before Pharaoh: and the woman was taken into Pharaoh's house.

net: While they were trying to kill him, a report was sent up to the commanding officer of the cohort that all Jerusalem was in confusion.
kjv: And as they went about to kill him, tidings came unto the chief captain of the band, that all Jerusalem was in an uproar.

net: The one who had received the five talents came and brought five more, saying,‘Sir, you entrusted me with five talents. See, I have gained five more.’
kjv: ‹And so he that had received five talents came and brought other five talents, saying, Lord, thou deliveredst unto me five talents: behold, I have gained beside them five talents more.›

net: Beware, those who get up early to drink beer, those who keep drinking long after dark until they are intoxicated with wine.
kjv: Woe unto them that rise up early in the morning, [that] they may follow strong drink; that continue until night, [till] wine inflame them!

net: For the fields of Heshbon are dried up, as well as the vines of Sibmah. The rulers of the nations trample all over its vines, which reach Jazer and spread to the wilderness; their shoots spread out and cross the sea.
kjv: For the fields of Heshbon languish, [and] the vine of Sibmah: the lords of the heathen have broken down the principal plants thereof, they are come [even] unto Jazer, they wandered [through] the wilderness: her branches are stretched out, they are gone over the sea.

net: Civil Strife Mars the Victory The Ephraimites assembled and crossed over to Zaphon. They said to Jephthah,“Why did you go and fight with the Ammonites without asking us to go with you? We will burn your house down right over you!”
kjv: And the men of Ephraim gathered themselves together, and went northward, and said unto Jephthah, Wherefore passedst thou over to fight against the children of Ammon, and didst not call us to go with thee? we will burn thine house upon thee with fire.

net: They said to Joshua,“It was carefully reported to your subjects how the LORD your God commanded Moses his servant to assign you the whole land and to destroy all who live in the land from before you. Because of you we were terrified we would lose our lives, so we did this thing.
kjv: And they answered Joshua, and said, Because it was certainly told thy servants, how that the LORD thy God commanded his servant Moses to give you all the land, and to destroy all the inhabitants of the land from before you, therefore we were sore afraid of our lives because of you, and have done this thing.

net: But I have integrity! Rescue me and have mercy on me!
kjv: But as for me, I will walk in mine integrity: redeem me, and be merciful unto me.

net: Then he measured the length of the building facing the courtyard at the rear of the temple, with its galleries on either side as 175 feet. The interior of the outer sanctuary and the porch of the court,
kjv: And he measured the length of the building over against the separate place which [was] behind it, and the galleries thereof on the one side and on the other side, an hundred cubits, with the inner temple, and the porches of the court;

net: The Tabernacle“The tabernacle itself you are to make with ten curtains of fine twisted linen and blue and purple and scarlet
kjv: Moreover thou shalt make the tabernacle [with] ten curtains [of] fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet: [with] cherubims of cunning work shalt thou make them.

net: Who ever serves in the army at his own expense? Who plants a vineyard and does not eat its fruit? Who tends a flock and does not consume its milk?
kjv: Who goeth a warfare any time at his own charges? who planteth a vineyard, and eateth not of the fruit thereof? or who feedeth a flock, and eateth not of the milk of the flock?

net: Jonathan replied,“All right! We’ll go over to these men and fight them.
kjv: Then said Jonathan, Behold, we will pass over unto [these] men, and we will discover ourselves unto them.

net: On the tenth day of the fifth month, in the nineteenth year of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon, Nebuzaradan, the captain of the royal guard who served the king of Babylon, arrived in Jerusalem.
kjv: Now in the fifth month, in the tenth [day] of the month, which [was] the nineteenth year of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, came Nebuzaradan, captain of the guard, [which] served the king of Babylon, into Jerusalem,

net: Joram his son,Ahaziah his son,Joash his son,
kjv: Joram his son, Ahaziah his son, Joash his son,

net: If he designated her for his son, then he will deal with her according to the customary rights of daughters.
kjv: And if he have betrothed her unto his son, he shall deal with her after the manner of daughters.

net: We all growl like bears, we coo mournfully like doves; we wait for deliverance, but there is none, for salvation, but it is far from us.
kjv: We roar all like bears, and mourn sore like doves: we look for judgment, but [there is] none; for salvation, [but] it is far off from us.

net: But to those who are called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ is the power of God and the wisdom of God.
kjv: But unto them which are called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ the power of God, and the wisdom of God.

net: No one remembers the former events, nor will anyone remember the events that are yet to happen; they will not be remembered by the future generations.
kjv: [There is] no remembrance of former [things] neither shall there be [any] remembrance of [things] that are to come with [those] that shall come after.

net: “But I will repay Babylon and all who live in Babylonia for all the wicked things they did in Zion right before the eyes of you Judeans,” says the LORD.
kjv: And I will render unto Babylon and to all the inhabitants of Chaldea all their evil that they have done in Zion in your sight, saith the LORD.

net: You must count fifty days– until the day after the seventh Sabbath– and then you must present a new grain offering to the LORD.
kjv: Even unto the morrow after the seventh sabbath shall ye number fifty days and ye shall offer a new meat offering unto the LORD.

net: Then all the people returned to their homes, and David went to pronounce a blessing on his family.
kjv: And all the people departed every man to his house: and David returned to bless his house.

net: especially those who indulge their fleshly desires and who despise authority. Brazen and insolent, they are not afraid to insult the glorious ones,
kjv: But chiefly them that walk after the flesh in the lust of uncleanness, and despise government. Presumptuous [are they], selfwilled, they are not afraid to speak evil of dignities.

net: For he makes the bars of your gates strong. He blesses your children within you.
kjv: For he hath strengthened the bars of thy gates he hath blessed thy children within thee.

net: So about three thousand men went up, but they fled from the men of Ai.
kjv: So there went up thither of the people about three thousand men: and they fled before the men of Ai.

net: The Journey From Sinai to Kadesh On the twentieth day of the second month, in the second year, the cloud was taken up from the tabernacle of the testimony.
kjv: And it came to pass on the twentieth [day] of the second month, in the second year, that the cloud was taken up from off the tabernacle of the testimony.

net: The Ministry of John the Baptist In the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, when Pontius Pilate was governor of Judea, and Herod was tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip was tetrarch of the region of Iturea and Trachonitis, and Lysanias was tetrarch of Abilene,
kjv: Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being governor of Judaea, and Herod being tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip tetrarch of Ituraea and of the region of Trachonitis, and Lysanias the tetrarch of Abilene,

net: Jesus said to him,“Friend, do what you are here to do.” Then they came and took hold of Jesus and arrested him.
kjv: And Jesus said unto him, ‹Friend, wherefore art thou come?› Then came they, and laid hands on Jesus, and took him.

net: When he struck them down, they sought his favor; they turned back and longed for God.
kjv: When he slew them, then they sought him: and they returned and enquired early after God.

net: the one who led chariots and horses to destruction, together with a mighty army. They fell down, never to rise again; they were extinguished, put out like a burning wick:
kjv: Which bringeth forth the chariot and horse, the army and the power; they shall lie down together, they shall not rise: they are extinct, they are quenched as tow.

net: When God made me wander from my father’s house, I told her,‘This is what you can do to show your loyalty to me: Every place we go, say about me,“He is my brother.”’”
kjv: And it came to pass, when God caused me to wander from my father's house, that I said unto her, This [is] thy kindness which thou shalt shew unto me; at every place whither we shall come, say of me, He [is] my brother.

net: Why too are we in danger every hour?
kjv: And why stand we in jeopardy every hour?

net: Isn’t this David, of whom they sang as they danced,‘Saul has struck down his thousands, but David his tens of thousands’?”
kjv: [Is] not this David, of whom they sang one to another in dances, saying, Saul slew his thousands, and David his ten thousands?

net: Now the length of time it took for us to go from Kadesh Barnea to the crossing of Wadi Zered was thirty-eight years, time for all the military men of that generation to die, just as the LORD had vowed to them.
kjv: And the space in which we came from Kadeshbarnea, until we were come over the brook Zered, [was] thirty and eight years; until all the generation of the men of war were wasted out from among the host, as the LORD sware unto them.

net: In the past, even when Saul was king, you were Israel’s commanding general. The LORD your God said to you,‘You will shepherd my people Israel; you will rule over my people Israel.’”
kjv: And moreover in time past, even when Saul was king, thou [wast] he that leddest out and broughtest in Israel: and the LORD thy God said unto thee, Thou shalt feed my people Israel, and thou shalt be ruler over my people Israel.

net: Stay awake and pray that you will not fall into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
kjv: ‹Watch and pray, that ye enter not into temptation: the spirit indeed› [is] ‹willing, but the flesh› [is] ‹weak.›

net: Rejoice in the Lord always. Again I say, rejoice!
kjv: Rejoice in the Lord alway: [and] again I say, Rejoice.

net: Then the twenty-four elders who are seated on their thrones before God threw themselves down with their faces to the ground and worshiped God
kjv: And the four and twenty elders, which sat before God on their seats, fell upon their faces, and worshipped God,

net: Your knowledge is beyond my comprehension; it is so far beyond me, I am unable to fathom it.
kjv: [Such] knowledge [is] too wonderful for me; it is high, I cannot [attain] unto it.

net: Do not be led astray, my dear brothers and sisters.
kjv: Do not err, my beloved brethren.

net: As for you, O king, the most high God bestowed on your father Nebuchadnezzar a kingdom, greatness, honor, and majesty.
kjv: O thou king, the most high God gave Nebuchadnezzar thy father a kingdom, and majesty, and glory, and honour:

net: Year after year he used to travel the circuit of Bethel, Gilgal, and Mizpah; he used to judge Israel in all of these places.
kjv: And he went from year to year in circuit to Bethel, and Gilgal, and Mizpeh, and judged Israel in all those places.

net: Admonition to Avoid Easy but Unjust Riches My child, if sinners try to entice you, do not consent!
kjv: My son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not.

net: So then, if anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation; what is old has passed away– look, what is new has come!
kjv: Therefore if any man [be] in Christ, [he is] a new creature: old things are passed away; behold, all things are become new.

net: Now when Barzillai the Gileadite had come down from Rogelim, he crossed the Jordan with the king so he could send him on his way from there.
kjv: And Barzillai the Gileadite came down from Rogelim, and went over Jordan with the king, to conduct him over Jordan.

net: Now when Silas and Timothy arrived from Macedonia, Paul became wholly absorbed with proclaiming the word, testifying to the Jews that Jesus was the Christ.
kjv: And when Silas and Timotheus were come from Macedonia, Paul was pressed in the spirit, and testified to the Jews [that] Jesus [was] Christ.

net: and said to him,“This is what Jephthah says,‘Israel did not steal the land of Moab and the land of the Ammonites.
kjv: And said unto him, Thus saith Jephthah, Israel took not away the land of Moab, nor the land of the children of Ammon:

net: I will take away their harvests, says the LORD. There will be no grapes on their vines. There will be no figs on their fig trees. Even the leaves on their trees will wither. The crops that I gave them will be taken away.’”
kjv: I will surely consume them, saith the LORD: [there shall be] no grapes on the vine, nor figs on the fig tree, and the leaf shall fade; and [the things that] I have given them shall pass away from them.

net: But they were expecting that he was going to swell up or suddenly drop dead. So after they had waited a long time and had seen nothing unusual happen to him, they changed their minds and said he was a god.
kjv: Howbeit they looked when he should have swollen, or fallen down dead suddenly: but after they had looked a great while, and saw no harm come to him, they changed their minds, and said that he was a god.

net: the descendants of Zaccai, 760;
kjv: The children of Zaccai, seven hundred and threescore.

net: And in the first year of Darius the Mede, I stood to strengthen him and to provide protection for him.)
kjv: Also I in the first year of Darius the Mede, [even] I, stood to confirm and to strengthen him.

net: But Jesus realized their evil intentions and said,“Hypocrites! Why are you testing me?
kjv: But Jesus perceived their wickedness, and said, ‹Why tempt ye me,› [ye] ‹hypocrites?›

net: “‘I the LORD have spoken; judgment is coming and I will act! I will not relent, or show pity, or be sorry! I will judge you according to your conduct and your deeds, declares the Sovereign LORD.’”
kjv: I the LORD have spoken [it]: it shall come to pass, and I will do [it]; I will not go back, neither will I spare, neither will I repent; according to thy ways, and according to thy doings, shall they judge thee, saith the Lord GOD.

net: If you do not listen and take seriously the need to honor my name,” says the LORD of Heaven’s Armies,“I will send judgment on you and turn your blessings into curses– indeed, I have already done so because you are not taking it to heart.
kjv: If ye will not hear, and if ye will not lay [it] to heart, to give glory unto my name, saith the LORD of hosts, I will even send a curse upon you, and I will curse your blessings: yea, I have cursed them already, because ye do not lay [it] to heart.

net: the king of Jarmuth(one), the king of Lachish(one),
kjv: The king of Jarmuth, one; the king of Lachish, one;

net: Here are my virgin daughter and my guest’s concubine. I will send them out and you can abuse them and do to them whatever you like. But don’t do such a disgraceful thing to this man!”
kjv: Behold, [here is] my daughter a maiden, and his concubine; them I will bring out now, and humble ye them, and do with them what seemeth good unto you: but unto this man do not so vile a thing.

net: From Adam to Noah This is the record of the family line of Adam.When God created humankind, he made them in the likeness of God.
kjv: This [is] the book of the generations of Adam. In the day that God created man, in the likeness of God made he him;

net: If I then, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you too ought to wash one another’s feet.
kjv: ‹If I then,› [your] ‹Lord and Master, have washed your feet; ye also ought to wash one another's feet.›

net: Third Prediction of Jesus’ Death and Resurrection As Jesus was going up to Jerusalem, he took the twelve aside privately and said to them on the way,
kjv: And Jesus going up to Jerusalem took the twelve disciples apart in the way, and said unto them,

net: A song of ascents. I look up toward you, the one enthroned in heaven.
kjv: A Song of degrees. Unto thee lift I up mine eyes, O thou that dwellest in the heavens.

net: The LORD is your protector
kjv: The LORD [is] thy keeper: the LORD [is] thy shade upon thy right hand.

net: For the music director; to be accompanied by stringed instruments; a psalm of Asaph, a song. God has revealed himself in Judah; in Israel his reputation is great.
kjv: To the chief Musician on Neginoth, A Psalm [or] Song of Asaph. In Judah [is] God known: his name [is] great in Israel.

net: He reached a certain place where he decided to camp because the sun had gone down. He took one of the stones and placed it near his head. Then he fell asleep in that place
kjv: And he lighted upon a certain place, and tarried there all night, because the sun was set; and he took of the stones of that place, and put [them for] his pillows, and lay down in that place to sleep.

net: So his parents replied,“We know that this is our son and that he was born blind.
kjv: His parents answered them and said, We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind:

net: Locate precisely all the places where he hides and return to me with dependable information. Then I will go with you. If he is in the land, I will find him among all the thousands of Judah.”
kjv: See therefore, and take knowledge of all the lurking places where he hideth himself, and come ye again to me with the certainty, and I will go with you: and it shall come to pass, if he be in the land, that I will search him out throughout all the thousands of Judah.

net: They hired 32,000 chariots, along with the king of Maacah and his army, who came and camped in front of Medeba. The Ammonites also assembled from their cities and marched out to do battle.
kjv: So they hired thirty and two thousand chariots, and the king of Maachah and his people; who came and pitched before Medeba. And the children of Ammon gathered themselves together from their cities, and came to battle.

net: Grieve, mourn, and weep. Turn your laughter into mourning and your joy into despair.
kjv: Be afflicted, and mourn, and weep: let your laughter be turned to mourning, and [your] joy to heaviness.

net: But God said to Balaam,“You must not go with them; you must not curse the people, for they are blessed.”
kjv: And God said unto Balaam, Thou shalt not go with them; thou shalt not curse the people: for they [are] blessed.

net: The Parable of the Sower While a large crowd was gathering and people were coming to Jesus from one town after another, he spoke to them in a parable:
kjv: And when much people were gathered together, and were come to him out of every city, he spake by a parable:

net: Then all the people will hear and be afraid, and not be so presumptuous again.
kjv: And all the people shall hear, and fear, and do no more presumptuously.

net: A ruler will be established from Jacob
kjv: Out of Jacob shall come he that shall have dominion, and shall destroy him that remaineth of the city.

net: The Destruction of the Temple Now as Jesus was going out of the temple courts and walking away, his disciples came to show him the temple buildings.
kjv: And Jesus went out, and departed from the temple: and his disciples came to [him] for to shew him the buildings of the temple.

net: Then on the eighth day she must take for herself two turtledoves or two young pigeons and she must bring them to the priest at the entrance of the Meeting Tent,
kjv: And on the eighth day she shall take unto her two turtles, or two young pigeons, and bring them unto the priest, to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.

net: Jesus replied,“If I want him to live until I come back, what concern is that of yours? You follow me!”
kjv: Jesus saith unto him, ‹If I will that he tarry till I come, what› [is that] ‹to thee? follow thou me.›

net: Who is this majestic king? The LORD of Heaven’s Armies! He is the majestic king!(Selah)
kjv: Who is this King of glory? The LORD of hosts, he [is] the King of glory. Selah.

net: They come with red cloth from Egypt, Ethiopia voluntarily offers tribute to God.
kjv: Princes shall come out of Egypt Ethiopia shall soon stretch out her hands unto God.

net: Respond to the request of your servant and your people Israel for this place. Hear from inside your heavenly dwelling place and respond favorably.
kjv: And hearken thou to the supplication of thy servant, and of thy people Israel, when they shall pray toward this place: and hear thou in heaven thy dwelling place: and when thou hearest, forgive.

net: There were seven brothers. The first one married, and when he died he had no children.
kjv: Now there were seven brethren: and the first took a wife, and dying left no seed.

net: But Abraham lodged a complaint against Abimelech concerning a well that Abimelech’s servants had seized.
kjv: And Abraham reproved Abimelech because of a well of water, which Abimelech's servants had violently taken away.

net: All of them were listed in the genealogical records in the time of King Jotham of Judah and in the time of King Jeroboam of Israel.
kjv: All these were reckoned by genealogies in the days of Jotham king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam king of Israel.

net: So put to death whatever in your nature belongs to the earth: sexual immorality, impurity, shameful passion, evil desire, and greed which is idolatry.
kjv: Mortify therefore your members which are upon the earth; fornication, uncleanness, inordinate affection, evil concupiscence, and covetousness, which is idolatry:

net: A well-written song by Asaph. Pay attention, my people, to my instruction! Listen to the words I speak!
kjv: Maschil of Asaph. Give ear, O my people, [to] my law: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

net: The sons of Rachel were Joseph and Benjamin.
kjv: The sons of Rachel; Joseph, and Benjamin:

net: “Suppose such a man has a violent son who sheds blood and does any of these things mentioned previously
kjv: If he beget a son [that is] a robber, a shedder of blood, and [that] doeth the like to [any] one of these [things],

net: Rehoboam passed away and was buried with his ancestors in the City of David. His mother was an Ammonite named Naamah. His son Abijah replaced him as king.
kjv: And Rehoboam slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David. And his mother's name [was] Naamah an Ammonitess. And Abijam his son reigned in his stead.

net: Anyone who touches his bed must wash his clothes, bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
kjv: And whosoever toucheth his bed shall wash his clothes, and bathe [himself] in water, and be unclean until the even.

net: If it does not accept terms of peace but makes war with you, then you are to lay siege to it.
kjv: And if it will make no peace with thee, but will make war against thee, then thou shalt besiege it:

net: I am against you and your waterways. I will turn the land of Egypt into an utter desolate ruin from Migdol to Syene, as far as the border with Ethiopia.
kjv: Behold, therefore I [am] against thee, and against thy rivers, and I will make the land of Egypt utterly waste [and] desolate, from the tower of Syene even unto the border of Ethiopia.

net: and saying,“The Lord has really risen, and has appeared to Simon!”
kjv: Saying, The Lord is risen indeed, and hath appeared to Simon.

net: Now when the owner of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those tenants?”
kjv: ‹When the lord therefore of the vineyard cometh, what will he do unto those husbandmen?›

net: They had entered the house while Ish-bosheth was resting on his bed in his bedroom. They mortally wounded him and then cut off his head. Taking his head, they traveled on the way of the rift valley all that night.
kjv: For when they came into the house, he lay on his bed in his bedchamber, and they smote him, and slew him, and beheaded him, and took his head, and gat them away through the plain all night.

net: Ahaz was twenty years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for sixteen years in Jerusalem. He did not do what pleased the LORD his God, in contrast to his ancestor David.
kjv: Twenty years old [was] Ahaz when he began to reign, and reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem, and did not [that which was] right in the sight of the LORD his God, like David his father.

net: This will bring healing to your body, and refreshment to your inner self.
kjv: It shall be health to thy navel, and marrow to thy bones.

net: When you summon her for divorce, you prosecute her; he drives her away with his strong wind in the day of the east wind.
kjv: In measure, when it shooteth forth, thou wilt debate with it: he stayeth his rough wind in the day of the east wind.

net: He may eat both the most holy and the holy food of his God,
kjv: He shall eat the bread of his God, [both] of the most holy, and of the holy.

net: Be very strong! Carefully obey all that is written in the law scroll of Moses so you won’t swerve from it to the right or the left,
kjv: Be ye therefore very courageous to keep and to do all that is written in the book of the law of Moses, that ye turn not aside therefrom [to] the right hand or [to] the left;

net: so that your feet may stomp in their blood, and your dogs may eat their portion of the enemies’ corpses.”
kjv: That thy foot may be dipped in the blood of [thine] enemies, [and] the tongue of thy dogs in the same.

net: And he said to mankind,‘The fear of the LORD– that is wisdom, and to turn away from evil is understanding.’”
kjv: And unto man he said, Behold, the fear of the Lord, that [is] wisdom; and to depart from evil [is] understanding.

net: with all humility and gentleness, with patience, putting up with one another in love,
kjv: With all lowliness and meekness, with longsuffering, forbearing one another in love;

net: For how can I go back to my father if the boy is not with me? I couldn’t bear to see my father’s pain.”
kjv: For how shall I go up to my father, and the lad [be] not with me? lest peradventure I see the evil that shall come on my father.

net: But the LORD God called to the man and said to him,“Where are you?”
kjv: And the LORD God called unto Adam, and said unto him, Where [art] thou?

net: Laws about Property(21:37)“If a man steals an ox or a sheep and kills it or sells it, he must pay back five head of cattle for the ox, and four sheep for the one sheep.
kjv: If a man shall steal an ox, or a sheep, and kill it, or sell it; he shall restore five oxen for an ox, and four sheep for a sheep.

net: He has not looked on iniquity in Jacob, nor has he seen trouble in Israel. The LORD their God is with them; his acclamation as king is among them.
kjv: He hath not beheld iniquity in Jacob, neither hath he seen perverseness in Israel: the LORD his God [is] with him, and the shout of a king [is] among them.

net: They said to King Nebuchadnezzar,“O king, live forever!
kjv: They spake and said to the king Nebuchadnezzar, O king, live for ever.

net: When Joab saw that the battle would be fought on two fronts, he chose some of Israel’s best men and deployed them against the Arameans.
kjv: Now when Joab saw that the battle was set against him before and behind, he chose out of all the choice of Israel, and put [them] in array against the Syrians.

net: Jesus Brought Before Pilate Then the whole group of them rose up and brought Jesus before Pilate.
kjv: And the whole multitude of them arose, and led him unto Pilate.

net: Has the LORD struck down Israel like he did their oppressors? Has Israel been killed like their enemies?
kjv: Hath he smitten him, as he smote those that smote him? [or] is he slain according to the slaughter of them that are slain by him?

net: “If someone should attempt a word with you, will you be impatient? But who can refrain from speaking?
kjv: [If] we assay to commune with thee, wilt thou be grieved? but who can withhold himself from speaking?

net: If she does not please her master, who has designated her for himself, then he must let her be redeemed. He has no right to sell her to a foreign nation, because he has dealt deceitfully with her.
kjv: If she please not her master, who hath betrothed her to himself, then shall he let her be redeemed: to sell her unto a strange nation he shall have no power, seeing he hath dealt deceitfully with her.

net: They surrounded me, yes, they surrounded me. Indeed, in the name of the LORD I pushed them away.
kjv: They compassed me about; yea, they compassed me about: but in the name of the LORD I will destroy them.

net: At this point the angelic messenger who spoke to me went out, and another messenger came to meet him
kjv: And, behold, the angel that talked with me went forth, and another angel went out to meet him,

net: For the music director, a psalm of David. O God whom I praise, do not ignore me!
kjv: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David. Hold not thy peace, O God of my praise;

net: “The LORD of Heaven’s Armies, the God of Israel says,‘I will break the yoke of servitude to the king of Babylon.
kjv: Thus speaketh the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, saying, I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon.

net: I will scatter them before their enemies like dust blowing in front of a burning east wind. I will turn my back on them and not look favorably on them when disaster strikes them.”
kjv: I will scatter them as with an east wind before the enemy; I will shew them the back, and not the face, in the day of their calamity.

net: He replied,“No, let the LORD help you. How can I help you? The threshing floor and winepress are empty.”
kjv: And he said, If the LORD do not help thee, whence shall I help thee? out of the barnfloor, or out of the winepress?

net: Prophecy Against the South(21:1) The LORD’s message came to me:
kjv: Moreover the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,

net: Yes, this is what the LORD has said to the people of Judah and Jerusalem:“Break up your unplowed ground, do not cast seeds among thorns.
kjv: For thus saith the LORD to the men of Judah and Jerusalem, Break up your fallow ground, and sow not among thorns.

net: If they obey and serve him, they live out their days in prosperity and their years in pleasantness.
kjv: If they obey and serve [him], they shall spend their days in prosperity, and their years in pleasures.

net: His disciples asked him,“Rabbi, who committed the sin that caused him to be born blind, this man or his parents?”
kjv: And his disciples asked him, saying, Master, who did sin, this man, or his parents, that he was born blind?

net: So now the sword will never depart from your house. For you have despised me by taking the wife of Uriah the Hittite as your own!’
kjv: Now therefore the sword shall never depart from thine house; because thou hast despised me, and hast taken the wife of Uriah the Hittite to be thy wife.

net: “Speak to the Israelites and tell them,‘These are the LORD’s appointed times which you must proclaim as holy assemblies– my appointed times:
kjv: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, [Concerning] the feasts of the LORD, which ye shall proclaim [to be] holy convocations, [even] these [are] my feasts.

net: She is disobedient
kjv: She obeyed not the voice she received not correction

net: When the men of Israel who were in the valley and across the Jordan saw that the men of Israel had fled and that Saul and his sons were dead, they abandoned the cities and fled. The Philistines came and occupied them.
kjv: And when the men of Israel that [were] on the other side of the valley, and [they] that [were] on the other side Jordan, saw that the men of Israel fled, and that Saul and his sons were dead, they forsook the cities, and fled; and the Philistines came and dwelt in them.

net: For I am already being poured out as an offering, and the time for me to depart is at hand.
kjv: For I am now ready to be offered, and the time of my departure is at hand.

net: (Look! He is returning with the clouds, and every eye will see him, even those who pierced him, and all the tribes on the earth will mourn because of him. This will certainly come to pass! Amen.)
kjv: Behold, he cometh with clouds; and every eye shall see him, and they [also] which pierced him: and all kindreds of the earth shall wail because of him. Even so, Amen.

net: Egypt will run away, hissing like a snake, as the enemy comes marching up in force. They will come against her with axes as if they were woodsmen chopping down trees.
kjv: The voice thereof shall go like a serpent; for they shall march with an army, and come against her with axes, as hewers of wood.

net: but emptied himself by taking on the form of a slave, by looking like other men, and by sharing in human nature.
kjv: But made himself of no reputation, and took upon him the form of a servant, and was made in the likeness of men:

net: Your deliverance brings him great honor
kjv: His glory [is] great in thy salvation: honour and majesty hast thou laid upon him.

net: Rebuking the Pharisees and Experts in the Law As he spoke, a Pharisee invited Jesus to have a meal with him, so he went in and took his place at the table.
kjv: And as he spake, a certain Pharisee besought him to dine with him: and he went in, and sat down to meat.

net: Elijah replied to the captain,“If I am indeed a prophet, may fire come down from the sky and consume you and your fifty soldiers!” Fire then came down from the sky and consumed him and his fifty soldiers.
kjv: And Elijah answered and said to the captain of fifty, If I [be] a man of God, then let fire come down from heaven, and consume thee and thy fifty. And there came down fire from heaven, and consumed him and his fifty.

net: I will sing a song that imparts wisdom
kjv: I will open my mouth in a parable: I will utter dark sayings of old:

net: When we heard the news we lost our courage and no one could even breathe for fear of you. For the LORD your God is God in heaven above and on earth below!
kjv: And as soon as we had heard [these things], our hearts did melt, neither did there remain any more courage in any man, because of you: for the LORD your God, he [is] God in heaven above, and in earth beneath.

net: When your ancestors went down to Egypt, they numbered only seventy, but now the LORD your God has made you as numerous as the stars of the sky.
kjv: Thy fathers went down into Egypt with threescore and ten persons and now the LORD thy God hath made thee as the stars of heaven for multitude.

net: For how can we thank God enough for you, for all the joy we feel because of you before our God?
kjv: For what thanks can we render to God again for you, for all the joy wherewith we joy for your sakes before our God;

net: And the LORD said,“If as one people all sharing a common language they have begun to do this, then nothing they plan to do will be beyond them.
kjv: And the LORD said, Behold, the people [is] one, and they have all one language; and this they begin to do: and now nothing will be restrained from them, which they have imagined to do.

net: Whatever someone among the Levites might redeem– the sale of a house which is his property in a city– must revert in the jubilee, because the houses of the cities of the Levites are their property in the midst of the Israelites.
kjv: And if a man purchase of the Levites, then the house that was sold, and the city of his possession, shall go out in [the year of] jubile: for the houses of the cities of the Levites [are] their possession among the children of Israel.

net: What is the result? Only that in every way, whether in pretense or in truth, Christ is being proclaimed, and in this I rejoice.Yes, and I will continue to rejoice,
kjv: What then? notwithstanding, every way, whether in pretence, or in truth, Christ is preached; and I therein do rejoice, yea, and will rejoice.

net: Healings at Simon’s House Now as soon as they left the synagogue, they entered Simon and Andrew’s house, with James and John.
kjv: And forthwith, when they were come out of the synagogue, they entered into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.

net: Then build an altar for the LORD your God on the top of this stronghold according to the proper pattern. Take the second bull and offer it as a burnt sacrifice on the wood from the Asherah pole that you cut down.”
kjv: And build an altar unto the LORD thy God upon the top of this rock, in the ordered place, and take the second bullock, and offer a burnt sacrifice with the wood of the grove which thou shalt cut down.

net: We have overpowered them; Heshbon has perished as far as Dibon. We have shattered them as far as Nophah, which reaches to Medeba.”
kjv: We have shot at them; Heshbon is perished even unto Dibon, and we have laid them waste even unto Nophah, which [reacheth] unto Medeba.

net: The king of Arad, the Canaanite king who lived in the south of the land of Canaan, heard about the approach of the Israelites.
kjv: And king Arad the Canaanite, which dwelt in the south in the land of Canaan, heard of the coming of the children of Israel.

net: The Illustration of Justification What then shall we say that Abraham, our ancestor according to the flesh, has discovered regarding this matter?
kjv: What shall we say then that Abraham our father, as pertaining to the flesh, hath found?

net: Ephron answered Abraham, saying to him,
kjv: And Ephron answered Abraham, saying unto him,

net: The sound of their voices shook the door frames, and the temple was filled with smoke.
kjv: And the posts of the door moved at the voice of him that cried, and the house was filled with smoke.

net: But they did not repudiate the sinful ways of the family of Jeroboam, who encouraged Israel to sin; they continued in those sins. There was even an Asherah pole standing in Samaria.
