net: Gideon took a hundred men to the edge of the camp at the beginning of the middle watch, just after they had changed the guards. They blew their trumpets and broke the jars they were carrying.
kjv: So Gideon, and the hundred men that [were] with him, came unto the outside of the camp in the beginning of the middle watch; and they had but newly set the watch: and they blew the trumpets, and brake the pitchers that [were] in their hands.

net: God appeared to Jacob again after he returned from Paddan Aram and blessed him.
kjv: And God appeared unto Jacob again, when he came out of Padanaram, and blessed him.

net: In the morning, when Nabal was sober, his wife told him about these matters. He had a stroke and was paralyzed.
kjv: But it came to pass in the morning, when the wine was gone out of Nabal, and his wife had told him these things, that his heart died within him, and he became [as] a stone.

net: He does not take his eyes off the righteous
kjv: He withdraweth not his eyes from the righteous: but with kings [are they] on the throne; yea, he doth establish them for ever, and they are exalted.

net: I will focus on your honor and majestic splendor, and your amazing deeds!
kjv: I will speak of the glorious honour of thy majesty, and of thy wondrous works.

net: Words of Reassurance I am writing to you, little children, that your sins have been forgiven because of his name.
kjv: I write unto you, little children, because your sins are forgiven you for his name's sake.

net: So the king said to Barzillai,“Cross over with me, and I will take care of you while you are with me in Jerusalem.”
kjv: And the king said unto Barzillai, Come thou over with me, and I will feed thee with me in Jerusalem.

net: And Aaron did so; he set up the lamps to face toward the front of the lampstand, as the LORD commanded Moses.
kjv: And Aaron did so; he lighted the lamps thereof over against the candlestick, as the LORD commanded Moses.

net: The new wine dries up, the vines shrivel up, all those who like to celebrate groan.
kjv: The new wine mourneth, the vine languisheth, all the merryhearted do sigh.

net: “You must not oppress a resident foreigner, since you know the life of a foreigner, for you were foreigners in the land of Egypt.
kjv: Also thou shalt not oppress a stranger: for ye know the heart of a stranger, seeing ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.

net: They had hair like women’s hair, and their teeth were like lions’ teeth.
kjv: And they had hair as the hair of women, and their teeth were as [the teeth] of lions.

net: but in the end she is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a two-edged sword.
kjv: But her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a twoedged sword.

net: The one who walks blamelessly will be delivered, but whoever is perverse in his ways will fall at once.
kjv: Whoso walketh uprightly shall be saved: but [he that is] perverse [in his] ways shall fall at once.

net: The Jewish leaders replied,“We are not going to stone you for a good deed but for blasphemy, because you, a man, are claiming to be God.”
kjv: The Jews answered him, saying, For a good work we stone thee not; but for blasphemy; and because that thou, being a man, makest thyself God.

net: So I said to them,‘Whoever has gold, break it off.’ So they gave it to me, and I threw it into the fire, and this calf came out.”
kjv: And I said unto them, Whosoever hath any gold, let them break [it] off. So they gave [it] me: then I cast it into the fire, and there came out this calf.

net: So Joseph, a Levite who was a native of Cyprus, called by the apostles Barnabas(which is translated“son of encouragement”),
kjv: And Joses, who by the apostles was surnamed Barnabas, (which is, being interpreted, The son of consolation,) a Levite, [and] of the country of Cyprus,

net: There will be two women grinding grain together
kjv: ‹Two› [women] ‹shall be grinding together; the one shall be taken, and the other left.›

net: The well which the princes dug, which the leaders of the people opened with their scepters and their staffs.”And from the wilderness they traveled to Mattanah;
kjv: The princes digged the well, the nobles of the people digged it, by [the direction of] the lawgiver, with their staves. And from the wilderness [they went] to Mattanah:

net: Joshua continued,“This is how you will know the living God is among you and that he will truly drive out before you the Canaanites, Hittites, Hivites, Perizzites, Girgashites, Amorites, and Jebusites.
kjv: And Joshua said, Hereby ye shall know that the living God [is] among you, and [that] he will without fail drive out from before you the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Hivites, and the Perizzites, and the Girgashites, and the Amorites, and the Jebusites.

net: Indeed, they have taken some of their daughters as wives for themselves and for their sons, so that the holy race has become intermingled with the local residents. Worse still, the leaders and the officials have been at the forefront of all of this unfaithfulness!”
kjv: For they have taken of their daughters for themselves, and for their sons: so that the holy seed have mingled themselves with the people of [those] lands: yea, the hand of the princes and rulers hath been chief in this trespass.

net: Ahab said to Naboth,“Give me your vineyard so I can make a vegetable garden out of it, for it is adjacent to my palace. I will give you an even better vineyard in its place, or if you prefer, I will pay you silver for it.”
kjv: And Ahab spake unto Naboth, saying, Give me thy vineyard, that I may have it for a garden of herbs, because it [is] near unto my house: and I will give thee for it a better vineyard than it; [or], if it seem good to thee, I will give thee the worth of it in money.

net: So then let those who suffer according to the will of God entrust their souls to a faithful Creator as they do good.
kjv: Wherefore let them that suffer according to the will of God commit the keeping of their souls [to him] in well doing, as unto a faithful Creator.

net: See, because the LORD has given you the Sabbath, that is why he is giving you food for two days on the sixth day. Each of you stay where you are; let no one go out of his place on the seventh day.”
kjv: See, for that the LORD hath given you the sabbath, therefore he giveth you on the sixth day the bread of two days; abide ye every man in his place, let no man go out of his place on the seventh day.

net: In this way God has snatched away your father’s livestock and given them to me.
kjv: Thus God hath taken away the cattle of your father, and given [them] to me.

net: Then the LORD’s angel said to her,“You are now pregnant and are about to give birth to a son. You are to name him Ishmael, for the LORD has heard your painful groans.
kjv: And the angel of the LORD said unto her, Behold, thou [art] with child, and shalt bear a son, and shalt call his name Ishmael; because the LORD hath heard thy affliction.

net: Everyone who is caught will be stabbed
kjv: Every one that is found shall be thrust through and every one that is joined [unto them] shall fall by the sword.

net: The thin heads of grain swallowed up the seven good heads of grain. So I told all this to the diviner-priests, but no one could tell me its meaning.”
kjv: And the thin ears devoured the seven good ears: and I told [this] unto the magicians but [there was] none that could declare [it] to me.

net: These two have the power to close up the sky so that it does not rain during the time they are prophesying. They have power to turn the waters to blood and to strike the earth with every kind of plague whenever they want.
kjv: These have power to shut heaven, that it rain not in the days of their prophecy: and have power over waters to turn them to blood, and to smite the earth with all plagues, as often as they will.

net: After he had gone through those regions and spoken many words of encouragement to the believers there, he came to Greece,
kjv: And when he had gone over those parts, and had given them much exhortation, he came into Greece,

net: not pilfering, but showing all good faith, in order to bring credit to the teaching of God our Savior in everything.
kjv: Not purloining, but shewing all good fidelity; that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Saviour in all things.

net: It is written in the law:“By people with strange tongues and by the lips of strangers I will speak to this people, yet not even in this way will they listen to me,” says the Lord.
kjv: In the law it is written, With [men of] other tongues and other lips will I speak unto this people; and yet for all that will they not hear me, saith the Lord.

net: they would have swallowed us alive, when their anger raged against us.
kjv: Then they had swallowed us up quick, when their wrath was kindled against us:

net: Isaiah had not yet left the middle courtyard when the LORD’s message came to him,
kjv: And it came to pass, afore Isaiah was gone out into the middle court, that the word of the LORD came to him, saying,

net: and she fled into the wilderness where a place had been prepared for her by God, so she could be taken care of for 1,260 days.
kjv: And the woman fled into the wilderness, where she hath a place prepared of God, that they should feed her there a thousand two hundred [and] threescore days.

net: quenched raging fire, escaped the edge of the sword, gained strength in weakness, became mighty in battle, put foreign armies to flight,
kjv: Quenched the violence of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, out of weakness were made strong, waxed valiant in fight, turned to flight the armies of the aliens.

net: “I tell you, my friends, do not be afraid of those who kill the body, and after that have nothing more they can do.
kjv: ‹And I say unto you my friends, Be not afraid of them that kill the body, and after that have no more that they can do.›

net: They cast lots to determine their responsibilities– oldest as well as youngest, teacher as well as student.
kjv: And they cast lots, ward against [ward], as well the small as the great, the teacher as the scholar.

net: “You aggressively attacked me and tried to knock me down, but the LORD helped me.
kjv: Thou hast thrust sore at me that I might fall: but the LORD helped me.

net: Then those in Judah said,“The strength of the laborers has failed! The debris is so great that we are unable to rebuild the wall.”
kjv: And Judah said, The strength of the bearers of burdens is decayed, and [there is] much rubbish; so that we are not able to build the wall.

net: The LORD said to Moses:
kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

net: Exhortation to Unity and Love Therefore, as the elect of God, holy and dearly loved, clothe yourselves with a heart of mercy, kindness, humility, gentleness, and patience,
kjv: Put on therefore, as the elect of God, holy and beloved, bowels of mercies, kindness, humbleness of mind, meekness, longsuffering;

net: When Noah awoke from his drunken stupor he learned what his youngest son had done to him.
kjv: And Noah awoke from his wine, and knew what his younger son had done unto him.

net: An inheritance gained easily in the beginning will not be blessed in the end.
kjv: An inheritance [may be] gotten hastily at the beginning but the end thereof shall not be blessed.

net: You should have the same attitude toward one another that Christ Jesus had,
kjv: Let this mind be in you, which was also in Christ Jesus:

net: And he reveals this for correction, and says that they must turn from evil.
kjv: He openeth also their ear to discipline, and commandeth that they return from iniquity.

net: When their fathers or brothers come and protest to us, we’ll say to them,“Do us a favor and let them be, for we could not get each one a wife through battle. Don’t worry about breaking your oath! You would only be guilty if you had voluntarily given them wives.’”
kjv: And it shall be, when their fathers or their brethren come unto us to complain, that we will say unto them, Be favourable unto them for our sakes: because we reserved not to each man his wife in the war: for ye did not give unto them at this time, [that] ye should be guilty.

net: He tore down the quarters of the male cultic prostitutes in the LORD’s temple, where women were weaving shrines for Asherah.
kjv: And he brake down the houses of the sodomites, that [were] by the house of the LORD, where the women wove hangings for the grove.

net: The king then had the matter investigated and, finding it to be so, had the two conspirators hanged on a gallows. It was then recorded in the daily chronicles in the king’s presence.
kjv: And when inquisition was made of the matter, it was found out; therefore they were both hanged on a tree: and it was written in the book of the chronicles before the king.

net: By David; a well-written song. How blessed is the one whose rebellious acts are forgiven, whose sin is pardoned!
kjv: [A] Psalm of David, Maschil. Blessed [is he whose] transgression [is] forgiven, [whose] sin [is] covered.

net: and Jason has welcomed them as guests! They are all acting against Caesar’s decrees, saying there is another king named Jesus!”
kjv: Whom Jason hath received: and these all do contrary to the decrees of Caesar, saying that there is another king, [one] Jesus.

net: This is the account of Jacob.Joseph, his seventeen-year-old son, was taking care of the flocks with his brothers. Now he was a youngster working with the sons of Bilhah and Zilpah, his father’s wives. Joseph brought back a bad report about them to their father.
kjv: These [are] the generations of Jacob. Joseph, [being] seventeen years old, was feeding the flock with his brethren; and the lad [was] with the sons of Bilhah, and with the sons of Zilpah, his father's wives: and Joseph brought unto his father their evil report.

net: The Guards’ Report While they were going, some of the guard went into the city and told the chief priests everything that had happened.
kjv: Now when they were going, behold, some of the watch came into the city, and shewed unto the chief priests all the things that were done.

net: And the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron in Mount Hor, by the border of the land of Edom. He said:
kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses and Aaron in mount Hor, by the coast of the land of Edom, saying,

net: Now David had been thinking,“In vain I guarded everything that belonged to this man in the wilderness. I didn’t take anything from him. But he has repaid my good with evil.
kjv: Now David had said, Surely in vain have I kept all that this [fellow] hath in the wilderness, so that nothing was missed of all that [pertained] unto him: and he hath requited me evil for good.

net: The earth will stagger around like a drunk; it will sway back and forth like a hut in a windstorm. Its sin will weigh it down, and it will fall and never get up again.
kjv: The earth shall reel to and fro like a drunkard, and shall be removed like a cottage; and the transgression thereof shall be heavy upon it; and it shall fall, and not rise again.

net: When Esau looked up and saw the women and the children, he asked,“Who are these people with you?” Jacob replied,“The children whom God has graciously given your servant.”
kjv: And he lifted up his eyes, and saw the women and the children; and said, Who [are] those with thee? And he said, The children which God hath graciously given thy servant.

net: “Get away from this community, so that I can consume them in an instant!” But they threw themselves down with their faces to the ground.
kjv: Get you up from among this congregation, that I may consume them as in a moment. And they fell upon their faces.
